en: One who knows Me in this way is united with Me; and when, still aware of Me, he leaves the body, he is said to have already attained My Consciousness. There is no doubt about this, Arjun. It is essential for you to know Me because the Knowledge of Me relieves one of doubt, pain, and suffering.

sa:
. यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।
तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ॥
tl:
. yaṃ yaṃ vāpi smaranbhāvaṃ tyajatyante
kalevaram taṃ tamevaiti kaunteya sadā tadbhāvabhāvitaḥ
en: Arjun, whatever entity one thinks of at the time of death, he attains that and that alone in the next incarnation, simply because he has become absorbed in the thought of it.

sa:
. तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च ।
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयम् ॥
tl: . tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu māmanusmara yudhya ca mayyarpitamanobuddhirmāmevaiṣyasyasaṃśayam
en:
Arjun, if you want to attain Me here and hereafter, then think of Me at all times. Even while fighting, set your mind and intellect on Me. There can be no doubt that this practice of remembering Me will keep you united with Me.
The technique of remembering Me is to know Me, the pure, conscious Being in your head, as the one remembering Me. It is not a form or a face that you remember. You must know Me as I know Myself—existing everywhere. Only when you are tuned to this Awareness of Mine will you succeed in holding Me in your mind at all times. Through this practice, the Me in you and Me in Me will attain that Consciousness which knows, in its identity, Me as the Whole. Oneness with Me will never be attained if you keep following the process of seeing Me through your eyes as a separate being and knowing Me and you to be separate from one another.

sa:
. अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना ।
परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥
tl:
. abhyāsayogayuktena cetasā nānyagāminā
paramaṃ puruṣaṃ divyaṃ yāti pārthānucintayan
en: Arjun, he who constantly engages his mind in meditation on Me attains the Consciousness of the supremely effulgent, divine Purush which is Me, God. Unlike one of merely human, mortal consciousness, he never suffers from fear.

sa:
. कविं पुराणमनुशासितार- मणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः ।
सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूप- मादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ॥
tl:
. kaviṃ purāṇamanuśāsitāra- maṇoraṇīyāṃsamanusmaredyaḥ
sarvasya dhātāramacintyarūpa- mādityavarṇaṃ tamasaḥ parastāt
en: He who meditates on Me as all-wise, ageless, finer than fine, the force sustaining the universe, the knowingness of all, the most divine form, far, far beyond the capacity of the mind; his mind attains the capacity of My Consciousness.

sa:
. प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव ।
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥
tl:
. prayāṇakāle manasācalena bhaktyā yukto yogabalena caiva
bhruvormadhye prāṇamāveśya samyak sa taṃ paraṃ puruṣamupaiti divyam
en: Even when others see that he is leaving his body, the one who has attained the power that brings about the unity of his individual consciousness with My Consciousness does not forget that I, the divine Supreme Being, am totally one with him. He firmly holds his praan, or life energy, in the Space by focussing on the point between the eyebrows and contemplating on Me with steadfastness and full devotion. This will be the result of attaining Yog Power. Such a yogi does not suffer at all at the time of leaving the body.

sa:
. यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः ।
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं संग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥
tl:
. yadakṣaraṃ vedavido vadanti viśanti yadyatayo vītarāgāḥ
yadicchanto brahmacaryaṃ caranti tatte padaṃ saṃgraheṇa pravakṣye
en: I shall now speak of the Supreme Being whom the wise call indestructible, who is sought by recluses and those who constantly practise rememberance of Brahm—He who is the goal of everyone.

sa:
. सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च ।
मूध्न्र्याधायात्मनः प्राण- मास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥
tl:
. sarvadvārāṇi saṃyamya mano hṛdi
nirudhya ca mūdhnryādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇa- māsthito yogadhāraṇām
en: That Supreme Being at the back of all that can be perceived by the senses is Me. I can be reached if one closes all the functioning points of the senses and mind by firmly holding one’s vision and praan in the space of the head and then concentrating on Me.

sa:
. ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् ।
यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥
tl:
. omityekākṣaraṃ brahma vyāharanmāmanusmaran yaḥ
prayāti tyajandehaṃ sa yāti paramāṃ gatim
en: God Consciousness, which is free from any modification or destruction of form, is known by the word Om. He who repeats this word, My name, even at the time of death, reaches My Self, the source and goal of everyone.

sa:
. अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः ।
तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ॥
tl:
. ananyacetāḥ satataṃ yo māṃ smarati
nityaśaḥ tasyāhaṃ sulabhaḥ pārtha nityayuktasya yoginaḥ
en: Arjun, I am easily and immediately attained by him who constantly remembers Me with undivided, conscious vision and who remains absorbed in Me.

sa:
. मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् ।
नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥
tl:
. māmupetya punarjanma duḥkhālayamaśāśvatam
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṃsiddhiṃ paramāṃ gatāḥ
en: The result of attaining the highest Consciousness and uniting totally with Me is that the soul is no longer subject to birth and death, the cycle in which sorrow abides.

sa:
. आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन ।
मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥
tl:
. ābrahmabhuvanāllokāḥ punarāvartino’rjuna māmupetya
tu kaunteya punarjanma na vidyate
en: Arjun, all the states of manifestation are liable to appearance, disappearance, and reappearance; but he who has attained unity with Me, the One ever free from birth and death, is freed from the suffering caused by birth and death.

sa:
. सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यत् ब्रह्मणो विदुः ।
रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ॥
tl: . sahasrayugaparyantamaharyat brahmaṇo viduḥ rātriṃ yugasahasrāntāṃ te’horātravido janāḥ
en: Such a yogi is not disturbed by the idea of time because he has come to know that I am the One who is the cause of time and space.

sa:
. अव्यक्तात् व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।
रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ॥
tl: . avyaktāt vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavantyaharāgame rātryāgame pralīyante tatraivāvyaktasaṃjñake
en: All beings that exist in physical form emanate from the unmanifest at the time of the manifestation of the cosmos, and all beings merge back into that same field of unmanifest Brahm when manifestation is withdrawn.

sa:
. भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते ।
रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥
tl:
. bhūtagrāmaḥ sa evāyaṃ bhūtvā
bhūtvā pralīyate rātryāgame’vaśaḥ pārtha prabhavatyaharāgame
en: Arjun, such is the cycle of manifestation and dissolution with the multitude of beings appearing, dissolving, and reappearing again and again.

sa:
. परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः ।
यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥
tl:
. parastasmāttu bhāvo’nyo’vyakto’vyaktātsanātanaḥ yaḥ sa
sarveṣu bhūteṣu naśyatsu na vinaśyati
en: Prior to the unmanifest Creatrix, the force of creation, there is absolute, unmanifest Existence, which never perishes though all beings disappear and dissolve.

sa:
. अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् ।
यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥
tl:
. avyakto’kṣara ityuktastamāhuḥ paramāṃ gatim yaṃ
prāpya na nivartante taddhāma paramaṃ mama
en: Mortal beings are created by the force of consciousness which is the Supermind, the unmanifest, creative aspect of Truth Consciousness. Prior even to this is the level of My supreme abode, which is indestructible and is the supreme goal. Those who come to know My true nature as the Supreme Being are liberated.

sa:
. पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।
यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥
tl:
. puruṣaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā
labhyastvananyayā yasyāntaḥsthāni bhūtāni yena sarvamidaṃ tatam
en: To attain My eternal, unmanifest, supreme nature in whom all beings manifest and by whom all beings are pervaded, one must have exclusive devotion to Me.

sa:
. यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः ।
प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥
tl:
. yatra kāle tvanāvṛttimāvṛttiṃ caiva yoginaḥ
prayātā yānti taṃ kālaṃ vakṣyāmi bharatarṣabha
en: Arjun, I will describe the nature of that Consciousness attaining which yogis do not return to mortal existence. Also, I will describe the nature of that consciousness which does cause them to return to this mortal existence after their death. These two states of consciousness are called the two paths of departing.

sa:
. अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् ।
तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ॥
tl:
. agnirjyotirahaḥ śuklaḥ ṣaṇmāsā uttarāyaṇam
tatra prayātā gacchanti brahma brahmavido janāḥ
en: There is the path of the one who has become the Consciousness linked with the ascending or northward path of the original sun, the Light of God. If one departs following this path, that is, having attained this Consciousness, he succeeds in reaching Brahm, or God.

sa:
. धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् ।
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योति- र्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥
tl:
. dhūmo rātristathā kṛṣṇaḥ ṣaṇmāsā dakṣiṇāyanam
tatra cāndramasaṃ jyoti- ryogī prāpya nivartate
en: The other path, or state of consciousness, is that wherein the darkening, ignorant consciousness, the state of duality, dwells. If one departs from the world having followed this path, he must once again return to mortal existence.

sa:
. शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते ।
एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ॥
tl:
. śuklakṛṣṇe gatī hyete jagataḥ
śāśvate mate ekayā yātyanāvṛttimanyayāvartate punaḥ
en: The first path is considered to be the eternal Consciousness which is one with God, the supreme freedom. Having attained it, one is liberated. The second path is the state of ignorance. If one remains bound in the darkness of ignorance, he is subject to birth and death and will return to mortal existence again and again.

sa:
. नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन ।
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥
tl:
. naite sṛtī pārtha jānanyogī
muhyati kaścana tasmātsarveṣu kāleṣu yogayukto bhavārjuna
en: Knowing the secret of what results from following either of these two courses, the yogi becomes clear as to which path he must follow. Arjun, you should be steadfast on this bright path of Yog, the path of Self Realization, which alone will make you free from all fear.

sa:
. वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् ।
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥
tl:
. vedeṣu yajñeṣu tapaḥsu caiva dāneṣu yatpuṇyaphalaṃ
pradiṣṭam atyeti tatsarvamidaṃ viditvā yogī paraṃ sthānamupaiti cādyam
en:
He who has reached the state of Truth and has become one with Me attains that free state of Consciousness which transcends all rewards gained through the study of scriptures and the performance of sacrifices, austerities, and charities.
The chapter known as Akshar Brahm Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे ।
ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca idaṃ tu te guhyatamaṃ
pravakṣyāmyanasūyave jñānaṃ vijñānasahitaṃ yajjñātvā mokṣyase’śubhāt
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Since your consciousness does not become involved in fault-finding, I shall discuss at length the most secret Knowledge of the manifest and unmanifest Brahm, knowing which your mind will be uninfluenced by fear.

sa:
. राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् ।
प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ॥
tl: . rājavidyā rājaguhyaṃ pavitramidamuttamam pratyakṣāvagamaṃ dharmyaṃ susukhaṃ kartumavyayam
en: This Knowledge is the sovereign and most secret science of Raaj Yog. It is pure, imperishable, and unequalled. Its practice is very easy and delights the learner.

sa:
. अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परंतप ।
अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ॥
tl:
. aśraddadhānāḥ puruṣā dharmasyāsya
paraṃtapa aprāpya māṃ nivartante mṛtyusaṃsāravartmani
en: Arjun, those who have no faith in this Knowledge, or true religion, the basis of all states of knowledge, remain involved in the wheel of birth and death and do not attain unity with Me.

sa:
. मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना ।
मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ॥
tl:
. mayā tatamidaṃ sarvaṃ jagadavyaktamūrtinā
matsthāni sarvabhūtāni na cāhaṃ teṣvavasthitaḥ
en: I am the divine, unmanifest Pure Existence permeating all the beings of this universe. All beings exist because of Me, for I hold the seed idea which is the basis of their manifest existence. Thus, they are all, in their various states of existence, My manifestations. Yet, at the centre and totally uninvolved, I am the One who watches them.

sa:
. न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ।
भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ॥
tl:
. na ca matsthāni bhūtāni paśya
me yogamaiśvaram bhūtabhṛnna ca bhūtastho mamātmā bhūtabhāvanaḥ
en: Since all these beings are My manifest forms, they cannot be said to be living in Me as something separate. I create them with My power of Consciousness and I sustain them in their forms with the same divine power. Even though they are all My light forms, on the absolute level I am utterly uninvolved and watch them as their Witness Self.

sa:
. यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुःसर्वत्रगो महान् ।
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ॥
tl:
. yathākāśasthito nityaṃ vāyuḥsarvatrago
mahān tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni matsthānītyupadhāraya
en: Just as the infinite field of air, which is the outcome of aakaash, or space, remains forever in space and is never a reality separate from space, in the same way all beings, who are the outcome of My idea, or will, remain as their appearances but are never any reality other than Me.

sa:
. सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् ।
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ॥
tl:
. sarvabhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṃ yānti
māmikām kalpakṣaye punastāni kalpādau visṛjāmyaham
en: Arjun, by My will I dissolve all beings, who are nothing but appearances of Me, into My own power, Prakriti, where their appearance is freed. And by My will I order that same Prakriti, the infinite creative force, to send them forth again according to their seeds as they are contained in My idea.

sa:
. प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः ।
भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ॥
tl:
. prakṛtiṃ svāmavaṣṭabhya visṛjāmi
punaḥ punaḥ bhūtagrāmamimaṃ kṛtsnamavaśaṃ prakṛtervaśāt
en: All beings manifest again and again because I wish My own nature to release them into manifestation according to their respective seed natures, or karm, which are My originating ideas.

sa:
. न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनंजय ।
उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ॥
tl:
. na ca māṃ tāni
karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanaṃjaya udāsīnavadāsīnamasaktaṃ teṣu karmasu
en: Arjun, since I originate the forces of action and consciousness out of Myself, these forces do not bind Me. As the unattached and independent Self, I stand always alone and beyond the Creatrix, Prakriti, and her creation, the world.

sa:
. मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् ।
हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ॥
tl: . mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram hetunānena kaunteya jagadviparivartate
en: Arjun, you should understand Me as the Supreme Being emanating the forces of consciousness and existence out of Myself. These forces are Prakriti, which, acting as the Creatrix, brings forth the whole of creation according to the idea contained within Me. Thus, as long as I wish, this wheel of creation consisting of sentient and insentient beings goes on and on.

sa:
. अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् ।
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ॥
tl:
. avajānanti māṃ mūḍhā mānuṣīṃ
tanumāśritam paraṃ bhāvamajānanto mama bhūtamaheśvaram
en: Those who have not been given the power to know Me as the Supreme Being, the overlord of this entire creation, including the Creatrix, Prakriti, or nature, have to view Me as a human being; whereas, I am the One who knows My true nature as it is and have put on human semblance only to deliver perfect Consciousness to those beings who have become forgetful of My entire Self as One without a second.

sa:
. मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः ।
राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ॥
tl:
. moghāśā moghakarmāṇo moghajñānā vicetasaḥ
rākṣasīmāsurīṃ caiva prakṛtiṃ mohinīṃ śritāḥ
en: Those who have been taken in by delusive ignorance have embraced a demonic nature and entertain vain hopes and futile actions based on fruitless knowledge.

sa:
. महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः ।
भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ॥
tl:
. mahātmānastu māṃ pārtha
daivīṃ prakṛtimāśritāḥ bhajantyananyamanaso jñātvā bhūtādimavyayam
en: But on the other hand, Arjun, those pure souls who have known Me as the very source of all states of life and have become aware of the truth of My imperishable, eternal nature have embraced it and constantly worship or know Me as the Self of all beings.

sa:
. सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः ।
नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ॥
tl:
. satataṃ kīrtayanto māṃ yatantaśca
dṛḍhavratāḥ namasyantaśca māṃ bhaktyā nityayuktā upāsate
en: Such pure souls sing and talk about My glories and with firm resolve and single-minded devotion worship Me and practise meditation on Me, for they and I are one Reality.

sa:
. ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते ।
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ॥
tl:
. jñānayajñena cāpyanye yajanto
māmupāsate ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśvatomukham
en: Many try to know My true nature by following the path of study, or knowledge, and they worship Me by thinking about My formless aspect, with which they are one. There are many others who worship Me as the universal form and think about Me as the dweller in each diverse form.

sa:
. अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् ।
मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ॥
tl: . ahaṃ kraturahaṃ yajñaḥ svadhāhamahamauṣadham mantro’hamahamevājyamahamagnirahaṃ hutam
en: Arjun, I am revealing to you that I am the Whole. I am all ceremonies and all sacrifices. I am the offerings to the departed. I am herbs and food grains. I am mantr, the sound through which people connect with Me. I am the sacred fire in which oblations of clarified butter are offered, and I am the very oblations themselves, as well as the act of offering. Indeed, I am the thought behind all offerings, sacrifices, and ceremonies, and as such I am one with them all.

sa:
. पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः ।
वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ॥
tl:
. pitāhamasya jagato mātā dhātā
pitāmahaḥ vedyaṃ pavitramoṃkāra ṛksāma yajureva ca
en: Arjun, I am the sustainer and ruler of this universe. I am called its father, mother, grandfather. I am the One worth knowing. I am the purifier. I am the sacred mantr Om. I am the three Vedas, full of mantras.

sa:
. गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् ।
प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ॥
tl:
. gatirbhartā prabhuḥ sākṣī nivāsaḥ śaraṇaṃ
suhṛt prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṃ nidhānaṃ bījamavyayam
en: I am the ultimate goal of all. I am the supporter of all. I am the first of lawmakers, the Lord who supports this universe with cosmic rule. I am the witness of all. I am the shelter and abode of all beings. I am the well-wisher of all, and I do not seek any return for My well-wishing. I am the origin and end of all. I am the resting place and storehouse of all seeds, and I am the One whose seed, or existence, is imperishable. I am the Whole.

sa:
. तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च ।
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ॥
tl:
. tapāmyahamahaṃ varṣaṃ nigṛhṇāmyutsṛjāmi
ca amṛtaṃ caiva mṛtyuśca sadasaccāhamarjuna
en: Arjun, I radiate Myself forth as the sun. I send forth showers and hold them back. I am immortal Existence, and I am the remover of all existent appearances. I am the One who is both being and beyond being, for I am the very purity of Being.

sa:
. त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते ।
ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक- मश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान् ॥
tl:
. traividyā māṃ somapāḥ pūtapāpā yajñairiṣṭvā svargatiṃ
prārthayante te puṇyamāsādya surendraloka- maśnanti divyāndivi devabhogān
en: Those who act according to the rules laid down in the three Vedas, who drink the sap of soma, which is the essence of the Knowledge of one’s true nature, and who purify themselves of duality, still gain access to the most refined and heavenly states even though they have worshipped Me with interested motives. There they enjoy celestial pleasures as the result of their virtuous deeds.

sa:
. ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति ।
एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥
tl:
. te taṃ bhuktvā svargalokaṃ viśālaṃ kṣīṇe
puṇye martyalokaṃ viśanti evaṃ trayīdharmamanuprapannā gatāgataṃ kāmakāmā labhante
en: Then, having enjoyed these celestial pleasures, their consciousness returns once again to the gross, earthly, mortal existence with a level of awareness befitting them. Thus, they are never united with God Consciousness and, forever unhappy, keep returning to live on earth. So, work done with interested motives does not bring peace because doers think that they are separate from Me.

sa:
. अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते ।
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ॥
tl:
. ananyāścintayanto māṃ ye janāḥ
paryupāsate teṣāṃ nityābhiyuktānāṃ yogakṣemaṃ vahāmyaham
en: I attend personally to those who constantly think of Me as the Supreme Being in the formless state of Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, and Pure Bliss, and who remain forever united with Me in their thought. I make them secure, safeguard their interests, and keep fulfilling their needs.

sa:
. येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः ।
तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ॥
tl:
. ye’pyanyadevatā bhaktā yajante
śraddhayānvitāḥ te’pi māmeva kaunteya yajantyavidhipūrvakam
en: Arjun, even though they are endowed with faith, some people worship the gods with interested motives; and that also is the worship of Me, although such an approach is actually mistaken, for these people understand Me to be separate from their own deities.

sa:
. अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च ।
न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ॥
tl:
. ahaṃ hi sarvayajñānāṃ bhoktā ca
prabhureva ca na tu māmabhijānanti tattvenātaścyavanti te
en: In reality, I am the One who is ultimately the Lord of all offerings and sacrifices, and I am also the receiver of those sacrifices. However, because they do not know Me as the all-pervading Supreme Being, worshippers with ulterior motives do not reach perfection. They fall victim to earthly consciousness.

sa:
. यान्ति देवव्रता देवान् पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः ।
भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ॥
tl:
. yānti devavratā devān pitṝnyānti pitṛvratāḥ
bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti madyājino’pi mām
en: Those who worship the gods become devoted to them, and those who adore ghostly spirits become devoted to them. Such people again and again enter the wheel of birth and death; but, Arjun, those who worship Me as their own Self come to Me and attain that state of Consciousness which saves them from victimization by birth and death.

sa:
. पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति ।
तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ॥
tl:
. patraṃ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ toyaṃ yo
me bhaktyā prayacchati tadahaṃ bhaktyupahṛtamaśnāmi prayatātmanaḥ
en: Arjun, I will reveal My loving, accepting, and innocent nature to you. If with love and devotion somebody offers Me water, fruit, flowers, or even a leaf, I appear before him in person. I partake of his selfless and innocent offering and enjoy it with delight.

sa:
. यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् ।
यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ॥
tl:
. yatkaroṣi yadaśnāsi yajjuhoṣi dadāsi
yat yattapasyasi kaunteya tatkuruṣva madarpaṇam
en: Arjun, you must keep in mind one very important point regarding your offerings to Me. Whatever you do, whether you eat, drink, offer an oblation, or perform a penance, just offer it all to Me and remain free.

sa:
. शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः ।
संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि ॥
tl: . śubhāśubhaphalairevaṃ mokṣyase karmabandhanaiḥ saṃnyāsayogayuktātmā vimukto māmupaiṣyasi
en: It is certain that in this way you will become free from the influence of duality which binds the mind to the good or evil fruits of action. Established in the consciousness of surrendering all your actions to Me, you will unite with Me and attain the joy of God Consciousness.

sa:
. समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः ।
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम् ॥
tl:
. samo’haṃ sarvabhūteṣu na me dveṣyo’sti na priyaḥ
ye bhajanti tu māṃ bhaktyā mayi te teṣu cāpyaham
en: No doubt I am equally present in all beings, and no one is hateful or dear to Me; but it is certain that to those who worship Me with love, I reveal Myself as their own Self.

sa:
. अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक् ।
साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः ॥
tl:
. api cetsudurācāro bhajate māmananyabhāk
sādhureva sa mantavyaḥ samyagvyavasito hi saḥ
en: Arjun, I am so much in love with devotion and the thought of union with Myself that if even the wildest sinner worships Me with exclusive devotion, I treat him as a saint simply because of his positive belief and faith in Me.

sa:
. क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति ।
कौन्तेय प्रति जानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति ॥
tl:
. kṣipraṃ bhavati dharmātmā śaśvacchāntiṃ nigacchati
kaunteya prati jānīhi na me bhaktaḥ praṇaśyati
en: And if he worships Me with vigour, he quickly becomes virtuous and gains lasting peace. Arjun, know definitely that one who is devoted to Me is never destroyed.

sa:
. मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः ।
स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥
tl:
. māṃ hi pārtha vyapāśritya ye’pi syuḥ
pāpayonayaḥ striyo vaiśyāstathā śūdrāste’pi yānti parāṃ gatim
en: Anybody, no matter what his profession or status, whether trader, labourer, male, or female, if he worships and becomes united in thought with Me, he attains the supreme goal, the state of Self Realization.

sa:
. किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा ।
अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम् ॥
tl:
. kiṃ punarbrāhmaṇāḥ puṇyā bhaktā
rājarṣayastathā anityamasukhaṃ lokamimaṃ prāpya bhajasva mām
en: And if such a person, busy in his own work, can reach Me, why not he who, with enough time, constantly worships by meditating on Me? He reaches Me even sooner.

sa:
. मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।
मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः ॥
tl:
. manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī
māṃ namaskuru māmevaiṣyasi yuktvaivamātmānaṃ matparāyaṇaḥ
en:
Therefore, Arjun, fix your mind on Me, devote yourself to Me, and worship and make obeisance to Me. By uniting yourself with Me and thoroughly knowing Me as your own Self, you shall definitely come to Me and attain God Consciousness.
The chapter known as Raaj Vidyaa Raaj Guhya Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः ।
यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca bhūya eva mahābāho śṛṇu me
paramaṃ vacaḥ yatte’haṃ prīyamāṇāya vakṣyāmi hitakāmyayā
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, in order to ground you firmly in Knowledge, I will speak My supreme word to you once again.

sa:
. न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः ।
अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः ॥
tl:
. na me viduḥ suragaṇāḥ prabhavaṃ
na maharṣayaḥ ahamādirhi devānāṃ maharṣīṇāṃ ca sarvaśaḥ
en: Even for gods or great men, it is not easy to know the secret of My appearance in human form, or in any other form which I assume through My own Self-will, because I am the ultimate cause of all the states and forms of gods and great seers.

sa:
. यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम् ।
असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
tl:
. yo māmajamanādiṃ ca vetti
lokamaheśvaram asaṃmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣu sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate
en: I am the Whole and thus I am free from the traits of birth and death; but because of My appearance as a form, no human mind knows Me as birthless and deathless. He who knows Me to be in reality without beginning and the Supreme Lord of all the laws of the universe is liberated from the influence of delusion.

sa:
. बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः ।
सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च ॥
tl:
. buddhirjñānamasaṃmohaḥ kṣamā satyaṃ damaḥ śamaḥ
sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ bhavo’bhāvo bhayaṃ cābhayameva ca
en: Mental knowledge, clear understanding, the discriminating intellect which determines what is worth accepting or rejecting, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, happiness, unhappiness, appearance, disappearance, fear, fearlessness, non-violence, evenness, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—all these traits found in various beings exist because of Me, for I am the source of all.

sa:
अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः ।
भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः ॥
tl:
ahiṃsā samatā tuṣṭistapo dānaṃ yaśo’yaśaḥ
bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṃ matta eva pṛthagvidhāḥ
en: Mental knowledge, clear understanding, the discriminating intellect which determines what is worth accepting or rejecting, forgiveness, truthfulness, control of the senses, control of the mind, happiness, unhappiness, appearance, disappearance, fear, fearlessness, non-violence, evenness, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—all these traits found in various beings exist because of Me, for I am the source of all.

sa:
. महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा ।
मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः ॥
tl:
. maharṣayaḥ sapta pūrve catvāro manavastathā
madbhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣāṃ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
en: The seven great seers Mareechi, Angiraa, Atri, Pulastya, Pulah, Kratu, and Vasishth have been considered the principal teachers of the Vedas, as have the four elders Sanak, Sanandan, Sanaatan, and Sanat Kumaar. In fact, all were My own forms, and through them I expounded the true nature of My Being. The fourteen manus, who in every yug, or age, regulated the operation of divine law and maintained the universe, were all devoted to Me. They all were born of My will to create progeny on earth.

sa:
. एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ।
सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
tl:
. etāṃ vibhūtiṃ yogaṃ ca mama yo
vetti tattvataḥ so’vikampena yogena yujyate nātra saṃśayaḥ
en: He who grasps the Knowledge and creative process of My supreme, divine glory and supernatural power becomes established in unity with Me through his unwavering devotion. There is no doubt about this.

sa:
. अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते ।
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः ॥
tl:
. ahaṃ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṃ
pravartate iti matvā bhajante māṃ budhā bhāvasamanvitāḥ
en: The wise, full of faith and devotion, know that I am the source of all that exists in the world, and they continue to evolve because of My power. They worship Me constantly and remain united with Me.

sa:
. मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम् ।
कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च ॥
tl:
. maccittā madgataprāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam kathayantaśca
māṃ nityaṃ tuṣyanti ca ramanti ca
en: Those who are devoted to Me keep their minds fixed on Me; they keep surrendering their actions to Me, and they enlighten one another by talking about Me. They are fulfilled in this lifetime, delighting in their consciousness which is one with Me.

sa:
. तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम् ।
ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते ॥
tl:
. teṣāṃ satatayuktānāṃ bhajatāṃ prītipūrvakam
dadāmi buddhiyogaṃ taṃ yena māmupayānti te
en: I reveal My true nature to those who are united with Me and worship Me with love and perfect devotion. The Wisdom I confer on them helps them to enjoy their liberated state of mind on earth.

sa:
. तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः ।
नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता ॥
tl: . teṣāmevānukampārthamahamajñānajaṃ tamaḥ nāśayāmyātmabhāvastho jñānadīpena bhāsvatā
en: In the hearts of My devotees I dwell and shower grace. I dispel their darkness born of the sense of duality just by illuminating their consciousness with My power.

sa:
. अर्जुन उवाच परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान् ।
पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम् ॥
tl:
. arjuna uvāca paraṃ brahma paraṃ dhāma
pavitraṃ paramaṃ bhavān puruṣaṃ śāśvataṃ divyamādidevamajaṃ vibhum
en:
Arjun said:
You are the eternal Supreme Being, the supreme purifier, unborn and all-pervading. All the seers including Naarad, Asit, Dayval, Vyaas, and now You have spoken of Your glories.

sa:
आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा ।
असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे ॥
tl:
āhustvāmṛṣayaḥ sarve devarṣirnāradastathā asito devalo
vyāsaḥ svayaṃ caiva bravīṣi me
en:
Arjun said:
You are the eternal Supreme Being, the supreme purifier, unborn and all-pervading. All the seers including Naarad, Asit, Dayval, Vyaas, and now You have spoken of Your glories.

sa:
. सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव ।
न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः ॥
tl:
. sarvametadṛtaṃ manye yanmāṃ vadasi keśava
na hi te bhagavanvyaktiṃ vidurdevā na dānavāḥ
en: I believe it all to be true, and I am aware that neither demons nor gods can know Your manifestation.

sa:
. स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम ।
भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते ॥
tl:
. svayamevātmanātmānaṃ vettha tvaṃ
puruṣottama bhūtabhāvana bhūteśa devadeva jagatpate
en: Oh Lord of lords, Supreme Being, I am sure that You alone know exactly what You are in Yourself.

sa:
. वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः ।
याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि ॥
tl: . vaktumarhasyaśeṣeṇa divyā hyātmavibhūtayaḥ yābhirvibhūtibhirlokānimāṃstvaṃ vyāpya tiṣṭhasi
en: You alone, therefore, are capable of describing Your divine glory with which You are permeating all these worlds.

sa:
. कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन् ।
केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया ॥
tl:
. kathaṃ vidyāmahaṃ yogiṃstvāṃ sadā paricintayan
keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyo’si bhagavanmayā
en: Oh Master of the source of all states of knowledge, through what exact process of thought or meditation shall I attain the Knowledge with which I may know You fully; and on what particular form of Yours should I meditate?

sa:
विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन ।
भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम् ॥
tl:
vistareṇātmano yogaṃ vibhūtiṃ ca janārdana
bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛptirhi śṛṇvato nāsti me’mṛtam
en: Krishn, I am thirsty to drink Your words of nectar again and again. Therefore, once more describe to me in detail Your Knowledge of Yog Power and its glory.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः ।
प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca hanta te kathayiṣyāmi divyā
hyātmavibhūtayaḥ prādhānyataḥ kuruśreṣṭha nāstyanto vistarasya me
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, there is no limit to the magnitude of My divine glories; therefore, I shall tell you of the most obvious.

sa:
. अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः ।
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च ॥
tl:
. ahamātmā guḍākeśa sarvabhūtāśayasthitaḥ ahamādiśca
madhyaṃ ca bhūtānāmanta eva ca
en: I am the universal Self Knowledge seated in the hearts of all beings as the awareness “I am.” As such, I alone am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.

sa:
. आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान् ।
मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी ॥
tl: . ādityānāmahaṃ viṣṇurjyotiṣāṃ raviraṃśumān marīcirmarutāmasmi nakṣatrāṇāmahaṃ śaśī
en: Of the twelve sons of Aditi, I am the glorious one, Vishnu; and of luminous objects, I am the sun. I am the glory of the forty-nine maruts, the wind gods.

sa:
. वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः ।
इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना ॥
tl:
. vedānāṃ sāmavedo’smi devānāmasmi
vāsavaḥ indriyāṇāṃ manaścāsmi bhūtānāmasmi cetanā
en: Of the Vedas, I am Saamvayd, full of sweetest saam, nectar, and the charming praise of God. Of the gods, I am Indra. Of the senses of perception, I am the mind. In living beings, I am the life energy of consciousness by which they know each other and experience pleasure and pain.

sa:
. रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम् ।
वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम् ॥
tl:
. rudrāṇāṃ śaṅkaraścāsmi vitteśo
yakṣarakṣasām vasūnāṃ pāvakaścāsmi meruḥ śikhariṇāmaham
en: Of the gods of destruction, I am Shankar. Of the yaksh and rakshas, I am Kubayr, the lord of riches. I am Pawak of the gods of fire, and of mountains I am Mayru, the centre of the stars and the repository of gold and jewels.

sa:
. पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम् ।
सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः ॥
tl:
. purodhasāṃ ca mukhyaṃ māṃ viddhi
pārtha bṛhaspatim senānīnāmahaṃ skandaḥ sarasāmasmi sāgaraḥ
en: Of priests, I am the chief, Brihaspati. Of warrior chiefs, I am Skand, the supreme commander of the gods. And of the waters, I am the ocean.

sa:
. महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम् ।
यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः ॥
tl: . maharṣīṇāṃ bhṛgurahaṃ girāmasmyekamakṣaram yajñānāṃ japayajño’smi sthāvarāṇāṃ himālayaḥ
en: Of the great seers, I am Bhrigu. Of words, I am Om. Of offerings, I am jap. And of immovable objects, I am the Himaalay.

sa:
. अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः ।
गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः ॥
tl:
. aśvatthaḥ sarvavṛkṣāṇāṃ devarṣīṇāṃ ca
nāradaḥ gandharvāṇāṃ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṃ kapilo muniḥ
en: Of trees, I am the holy Ashwatth. Of celestial sages, I am Naarad. Of the celestial musicians, I am Chitrarath. And of siddhas, I am the sage Kapil.

sa:
. उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम् ।
ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम् ॥
tl:
. uccaiḥśravasamaśvānāṃ viddhi māmamṛtodbhavam
airāvataṃ gajendrāṇāṃ narāṇāṃ ca narādhipam
en: Of horses, I am the celestial horse, Ucchaishrav. Of mighty elephants, I am Airaavat. And of men, I am the highest ruler.

sa:
. आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक् ।
प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः ॥
tl:
. āyudhānāmahaṃ vajraṃ dhenūnāmasmi
kāmadhuk prajanaścāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇāmasmi vāsukiḥ
en: Of weapons, I am the thunderbolt. Of cows, I am the celestial cow, Kaamdhaynu. I am the glory of the sexual desire which leads to procreation. Of serpents, I am Vaasuki.

sa:
. अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम् ।
पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम् ॥
tl:
. anantaścāsmi nāgānāṃ varuṇo
yādasāmaham pitṝṇāmaryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṃyamatāmaham
en: Of the celestial naags, I am the serpent god, Anant. Of aquatic creatures, I am Varun. Of the pitris, or ancestors, I am Aryamaa. And of rulers, I am the god of death.

sa:
. प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम् ।
मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम् ॥
tl:
. prahlādaścāsmi daityānāṃ kālaḥ kalayatāmaham
mṛgāṇāṃ ca mṛgendro’haṃ vainateyaśca pakṣiṇām
en: Of the family of daityas, or demons, I am Prahlaad, the devotee of God. Of reckoners, I am time. Of quadrupeds, I am the lion. And of birds, I am Garud.

sa:
. पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम् ।
झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी ॥
tl:
. pavanaḥ pavatāmasmi rāmaḥ
śastrabhṛtāmaham jhaṣāṇāṃ makaraścāsmi srotasāmasmi jāhnavī
en: Of purifiers, I am the wind. Of warriors, I am Raam. Of fish, I am Makar. Of rivers, I am Gangaa.

sa:
. सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन ।
अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम् ॥
tl: . sargāṇāmādirantaśca madhyaṃ caivāhamarjuna adhyātmavidyā vidyānāṃ vādaḥ pravadatāmaham
en: Arjun, I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all creations. Of sciences, I am the science of God. Of disputations, I am right reasoning.

sa:
. अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च ।
अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः ॥
tl:
. akṣarāṇāmakāro’smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya
ca ahamevākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṃ viśvatomukhaḥ
en: Of letters, I am the first, “A.” Of the compounds in Sanskrit grammar, I am the copulative. I am the devourer of time, and, with My face on all sides, I am the sustainer of all.

sa:
. मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम् ।
कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा ॥
tl:
. mṛtyuḥ sarvaharaścāhamudbhavaśca bhaviṣyatām kīrtiḥ
śrīrvākca nārīṇāṃ smṛtirmedhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
en: I am death that snatches all, and I am the origin of all that is born. Of women, I am Keerti, Shri, Vaak, Smriti, Maydhaa, Dhriti, and Chhamaa, who represent glory, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, steadfastness, and forgiveness.

sa:
. बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम् ।
मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः ॥
tl:
. bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnāṃ
gāyatrī chandasāmaham māsānāṃ mārgaśīrṣo’hamṛtūnāṃ kusumākaraḥ
en: Of the Shrutis, I am Brihatsaam. Of the hymns, I am Gaayatree. Of the twelve months, I am Maargsheersh. Of the six seasons, I am spring, the season of flowers.

sa:
. द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ।
जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम् ॥
tl: . dyūtaṃ chalayatāmasmi tejastejasvināmaham jayo’smi vyavasāyo’smi sattvaṃ sattvavatāmaham
en: Of deceitful practices, I am gambling. I am the glory of the glorious and the victory of the victorious. I am the resolve of the resolute and the goodness of the good.

sa:
. वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनंजयः ।
मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः ॥
tl:
. vṛṣṇīnāṃ vāsudevo’smi pāṇḍavānāṃ
dhanaṃjayaḥ munīnāmapyahaṃ vyāsaḥ kavīnāmuśanā kaviḥ
en: I am Krishn among the chhatriyas. I am Arjun among the sons of Paandu. I am Vyaas among the sages, and I am Shukraachaarya among the wise.

sa:
. दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम् ।
मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम् ॥
tl:
. daṇḍo damayatāmasmi nītirasmi jigīṣatām
maunaṃ caivāsmi guhyānāṃ jñānaṃ jñānavatāmaham
en: I am the subduing power in rulers. I am righteousness in conquerors. I am the reticence of secrets, and I am the wisdom of the wise.

sa:
. यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन ।
न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम् ॥
tl:
. yaccāpi sarvabhūtānāṃ bījaṃ tadahamarjuna
na tadasti vinā yatsyānmayā bhūtaṃ carācaram
en: Arjun, I am the seed of all life, for all creatures, moving or inert, exist in Me.

sa:
. नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परंतप ।
एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया ॥
tl:
. nānto’sti mama divyānāṃ vibhūtīnāṃ
paraṃtapa eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūtervistaro mayā
en: Arjun, My divine manifestations are unending; but since you asked for particular glories, I have given you a brief description.

sa:
. यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा ।
तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसंभवम् ॥
tl: . yadyadvibhūtimatsattvaṃ śrīmadūrjitameva vā tattadevāvagaccha tvaṃ mama tejoṃ’śasaṃbhavam
en: Arjun, know that anyone who is glorious, brilliant, and powerful represents the glory of My manifestation.

sa:
. अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन ।
विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत् ॥
tl:
. athavā bahunaitena kiṃ jñātena
tavārjuna viṣṭabhyāhamidaṃ kṛtsnamekāṃśena sthito jagat
en:
Arjun, even if I tell you in detail about all My glories, you will gain nothing. For this reason, it is sufficient for Me to say that I am the One who holds this entire universe with My Yog Power. If you know this, you know Me in all respects.
The chapter known as Vibhooti Yog ends.

sa:
अर्जुन उवाच मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम् ।
यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम ॥
tl:
arjuna uvāca madanugrahāya paramaṃ guhyamadhyātmasaṃjñitam
yattvayoktaṃ vacastena moho’yaṃ vigato mama
en:
Arjun said:
Krishn, I am grateful for this secret Knowledge of the Supreme Being which You with great kindness have imparted to me. It has removed my delusion entirely.

sa:
. भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया ।
त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम् ॥
tl:
. bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṃ śrutau
vistaraśo mayā tvattaḥ kamalapatrākṣa māhātmyamapi cāvyayam
en: Krishn, through Your teachings I have come to know in detail how beings evolve into manifestation and how their manifestation dissolves; and I have come to know Your supreme glory.

sa:
. एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर ।
द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम ॥
tl: . evametadyathāttha tvamātmānaṃ parameśvara draṣṭumicchāmi te rūpamaiśvaraṃ puruṣottama
en: O Supreme Lord, You are all that You have described to me, but I still long to see Your glorious form as You have described it, in all its vastness and effulgence.

sa:
. मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो ।
योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम् ॥
tl:
. manyase yadi tacchakyaṃ mayā draṣṭumiti
prabho yogeśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānamavyayam
en: If You consider that by now I have not only the desire but the ability to see Your infinite, imperishable, vast, and vivid form with all its glories, then, O Lord of Yog Power, please reveal it to me.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।
नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi
śataśo’tha sahasraśaḥ nānāvidhāni divyāni nānāvarṇākṛtīni ca
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, if you wish to see Me in this way, remain fearless and behold My manifold, divine forms of various colours, kinds, and shapes, and all my multiple, simultaneous happenings.

sa:
. पश्यादित्यान्वसून् रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा ।
बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत ॥
tl: . paśyādityānvasūn rudrānaśvinau marutastathā bahūnyadṛṣṭapūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata
en: Arjun, behold in Me the twelve sons of Aditi, the eight vasus, the eleven rudras, the two ashwin kumaars,  and the forty-nine maruts; that is, the suns, the governing powers of the world, the gods of destruction, the two beings born as physicians to the gods, and the forty-nine wind gods. You will see also many other forms, full of wonders you have never seen before.

sa:
. इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम् ।
मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद् द्रष्टुमिच्छसि ॥
tl:
. ihaikasthaṃ jagatkṛtsnaṃ paśyādya sacarācaram
mama dehe guḍākeśa yaccānyad draṣṭumicchasi
en: Arjun, whatever you desire to see, behold it concentrated within My body, which consists of all animate and inanimate beings.

sa:
. न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा ।
दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ॥
tl:
. na tu māṃ śakyase draṣṭumanenaiva svacakṣuṣā
divyaṃ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogamaiśvaram
en: But, Arjun, your physical eyes are not capable of seeing Me in My universal form; therefore, I shall open your divine eye, which will enable you to behold all My glories and powers of Yog.

sa:
. संजय उवाच एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः ।
दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम् ॥
tl:
. saṃjaya uvāca evamuktvā tato
rājanmahāyogeśvaro hariḥ darśayāmāsa pārthāya paramaṃ rūpamaiśvaram
en:
Sanjay, the communicator, said to Dhritraashtr:
Shri Krishn, the Supreme Master of Yog, the Lord of all beings, forthwith revealed His glorious, divine form to Arjun.

sa:
. अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् ।
अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् ॥
tl: . anekavaktranayanamanekādbhutadarśanam anekadivyābharaṇaṃ divyānekodyatāyudham
en: Arjun was astonished to see the Supreme God, possessing multiple mouths and eyes, presenting innumerable and wonderful scenes, decorated with many divine ornaments, wielding divine weapons, and wearing divine garlands and clothes, besmeared with divine sandal paste, and possessing infinite dimensions and faces on every side.

sa:
दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् ।
सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् ॥
tl: divyamālyāmbaradharaṃ divyagandhānulepanam sarvāścaryamayaṃ devamanantaṃ viśvatomukham
en: Arjun was astonished to see the Supreme God, possessing multiple mouths and eyes, presenting innumerable and wonderful scenes, decorated with many divine ornaments, wielding divine weapons, and wearing divine garlands and clothes, besmeared with divine sandal paste, and possessing infinite dimensions and faces on every side.

sa:
. दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता ।
यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः ॥
tl:
. divi sūryasahasrasya bhavedyugapadutthitā yadi
bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syādbhāsastasya mahātmanaḥ
en: The splendor of the Supreme Lord was such that even the effulgence of thousands of suns bursting into light all at once could hardly equal it.

sa:
. तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा ।
अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा ॥
tl: . tatraikasthaṃ jagatkṛtsnaṃ pravibhaktamanekadhā apaśyaddevadevasya śarīre pāṇḍavastadā
en: Arjun saw the whole universe with all its manifold divisions concentrated at one place in the person of Lord Krishn.

sa:
. ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनंजयः ।
प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत ॥
tl:
. tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭaromā
dhanaṃjayaḥ praṇamya śirasā devaṃ kṛtāñjalirabhāṣata
en: Having seen the supreme manifestation all in a moment, Arjun was overcome with wonder and his hair stood on end. Joining his palms together, he reverently bowed his head in obeisance to the Lord.

sa:
. अर्जुन उवाच पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान् ।
ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थ- मृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान् ॥
tl:
. arjuna uvāca paśyāmi devāṃstava deva dehe
sarvāṃstathā bhūtaviśeṣasaṅghān brahmāṇamīśaṃ kamalāsanastha- mṛṣīṃśca sarvānuragāṃśca divyān
en:
Arjun said:
Lord, I see within Your body all the gods of the universe, including Brahmaa enthroned on his lotus seat and Shiv with all the rishis. And I see divine energies flowing from every part of Your form.

sa:
. अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम् ।
नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप ॥
tl:
. anekabāhūdaravaktranetraṃ paśyāmi tvāṃ sarvato’nantarūpam nāntaṃ
na madhyaṃ na punastavādiṃ paśyāmi viśveśvara viśvarūpa
en: O Lord of the universe, I see You as having innumerable arms, bellies, mouths, eyes, and countless other forms extending on all sides. There is no beginning, no middle, and no end to Your universal manifestation.

sa:
. किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम् ।
पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ता- द्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् ॥
tl:
. kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakriṇaṃ ca tejorāśiṃ
sarvato dīptimantam paśyāmi tvāṃ durnirīkṣyaṃ samantā- ddīptānalārkadyutimaprameyam
en: I see You with discuses, diadems, and clubs; I see a mass of great effulgence flaming all around You with the brilliance of the glorious fire of suns. I find it hard to continue gazing, You are so vast, infinite, immeasurable in every direction.

sa:
. त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।
त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे ॥
tl:
. tvamakṣaraṃ paramaṃ veditavyaṃ tvamasya viśvasya paraṃ
nidhānam tvamavyayaḥ śāśvatadharmagoptā sanātanastvaṃ puruṣo mato me
en: Lord, You are the Supreme, the Indestructible, the most worthy of being known. You are the ultimate goal of this universe. You are the protector of the eternal dharm, the substance of religion. I realize You as the eternal and imperishable Supreme Being.

sa:
. अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्य- मनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् ।
पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् ॥
tl:
. anādimadhyāntamanantavīrya- manantabāhuṃ śaśisūryanetram paśyāmi
tvāṃ dīptahutāśavaktraṃ svatejasā viśvamidaṃ tapantam
en: I see You are without beginning, without middle, and without end. You possess unlimited powers and prowess in Your innumerable arms, and the moon and sun are in Your eyes. I see Your face as a blazing fire scorching this universe with its radiance.

sa:
. द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः ।
दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् ॥
tl:
. dyāvāpṛthivyoridamantaraṃ hi vyāptaṃ tvayaikena diśaśca
sarvāḥ dṛṣṭvādbhutaṃ rūpamugraṃ tavedaṃ lokatrayaṃ pravyathitaṃ mahātman
en: You are the One filling all the spaces of heaven and earth. O Lord, seeing this wonderful and terrible form of Yours, I, along with all the three worlds, am greatly frightened.

sa:
. अमी हि त्वां सुरसंघा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति ।
स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसंघाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः ॥
tl:
. amī hi tvāṃ surasaṃghā viśanti kecidbhītāḥ
prāñjalayo gṛṇanti svastītyuktvā maharṣisiddhasaṃghāḥ stuvanti tvāṃ stutibhiḥ puṣkalābhiḥ
en: I see groups of gods and multitudes of rishis, maharshis, and siddhas entering You. Some of them are uttering Your names and glories, saluting You with palms joined; and the maharshis and siddhas are saying, “Let there be peace, let there be peace.” Some are singing excellent hymns.

sa:
. रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च ।
गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसंघा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे ॥
tl:
. rudrādityā vasavo ye ca sādhyā
viśve’śvinau marutaścoṣmapāśca gandharvayakṣāsurasiddhasaṃghā vīkṣante tvāṃ vismitāścaiva sarve
en: I see the rudras, adityas, vasus, siddhas, vishyadayvs, kumaars, and maruts, along with the multitudes of gandharvs, yakshas, and asurs, all existing within You and gazing upon You in great wonderment.

sa:
. रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम् ।
बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम् ॥
tl:
. rūpaṃ mahatte bahuvaktranetraṃ mahābāho
bahubāhūrupādam bahūdaraṃ bahudaṃṣṭrākarālaṃ dṛṣṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitāstathāham
en: O mighty-armed Lord, after seeing Your infinitely vast and dreadful form possessed of infinite mouths, teeth, eyes, arms, feet, bellies, and faces, not only I but all the three worlds are terrified.

sa:
. नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम् ।
दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो ॥
tl:
. nabhaḥspṛśaṃ dīptamanekavarṇaṃ vyāttānanaṃ dīptaviśālanetram dṛṣṭvā hi
tvāṃ pravyathitāntarātmā dhṛtiṃ na vindāmi śamaṃ ca viṣṇo
en: O Lord, seeing Your form reaching to all the heavens and Your colourful, effulgent, and flaming aura all around You, I cannot maintain myself in balance. I am terribly frightened and find no peace even though I am realizing You as the all-pervading Lord Vishnu.

sa:
. दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि ।
दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥
tl:
. daṃṣṭrākarālāni ca te mukhāni dṛṣṭvaiva kālānalasannibhāni diśo
na jāne na labhe ca śarma prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa
en: Seeing Your frightful faces with their terrible teeth and seeing them spew the fire of universal destruction, I am totally bewildered and at a loss as to how to find happiness. I pray You, Lord of celestials, in whom the whole universe rests, shower Your grace on me once again.

sa:
. अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसंघैः ।
भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः ॥
tl:
. amī ca tvāṃ dhṛtarāṣṭrasya putrāḥ
sarve sahaivāvanipālasaṃghaiḥ bhīṣmo droṇaḥ sūtaputrastathāsau sahāsmadīyairapi yodhamukhyaiḥ
en: O Lord of Yog Power, I see all the sons of Dhritraashtr, many, many kings, along with Bheeshm, Dron, Karn, and all the principal warriors on both sides of this battlefield entering Your fearful jaws—and the whole image frightens me terribly. You are devouring many of them and some are stuck in the gaps of Your teeth with their heads crushed. I am terrified!

sa:
वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि ।
केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः ॥
tl:
vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśanti daṃṣṭrākarālāni
bhayānakāni kecidvilagnā daśanāntareṣu saṃdṛśyante cūrṇitairuttamāṅgaiḥ
en: O Lord of Yog Power, I see all the sons of Dhritraashtr, many, many kings, along with Bheeshm, Dron, Karn, and all the principal warriors on both sides of this battlefield entering Your fearful jaws—and the whole image frightens me terribly. You are devouring many of them and some are stuck in the gaps of Your teeth with their heads crushed. I am terrified!

sa:
यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति ।
तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति ॥
tl:
yathā nadīnāṃ bahavo’mbuvegāḥ samudramevābhimukhā dravanti
tathā tavāmī naralokavīrā viśanti vaktrāṇyabhivijvalanti
en: I see the warriors of this mortal world rushing into Your flaming mouths as fast as streaming rivers pouring into the ocean.

sa:
. यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः ।
तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोका- स्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः ॥
tl:
. yathā pradīptaṃ jvalanaṃ pataṅgā viśanti nāśāya
samṛddhavegāḥ tathaiva nāśāya viśanti lokā- stavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛddhavegāḥ
en: As poor moths out of the folly rush towards the blazing fire of their own extinction, all these people are rushing into Your mouths to meet annihilation.

sa:
. लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ता- ल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः ।
तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो ॥
tl:
. lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantā- llokānsamagrānvadanairjvaladbhiḥ
tejobhirāpūrya jagatsamagraṃ bhāsastavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣṇo
en: O Lord, the blazing mouths of Your terrible form are swallowing them all. Swiftly, You lick them up on every side. Your scorching splendours are burning the entire universe, filling it with fire.

sa:
. आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद ।
विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम् ॥
tl:
. ākhyāhi me ko bhavānugrarūpo namo’stu te devavara
prasīda vijñātumicchāmi bhavantamādyaṃ na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛttim
en: Tell me who You are, O Lord, with such a terrible form, I make obeisance to You, O God, but be kind to me and in particular let me know Your purpose, for I desire to know the Primal Being.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः ।
ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca kālo’smi lokakṣayakṛtpravṛddho lokānsamāhartumiha pravṛttaḥ ṛte’pi
tvāṃ na bhaviṣyanti sarve ye’vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣu yodhāḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, at this time I am Kaal, infinite, flaming, the eternal god of time, the destroyer of all the worlds. My purpose is to exterminate entirely the foolish warriors arrayed in the enemy ranks. You must realize that even without your killing them, these warriors cannot survive. They must die.

sa:
. तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम् ।
मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन् ॥
tl:
. tasmāttvamuttiṣṭha yaśo labhasva jitvā śatrūnbhuṅkṣva rājyaṃ
samṛddham mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvameva nimittamātraṃ bhava savyasācin
en: Therefore, Arjun, arise and conquer your foes, win glory, and enjoy your prosperous kingdom. As you have seen, I have already killed these warriors. Now it is simply a question of time and occasion, so just be the instrument.

sa:
. द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान् ।
मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान् ॥
tl:
. droṇaṃ ca bhīṣmaṃ ca jayadrathaṃ ca karṇaṃ tathānyānapi
yodhavīrān mayā hatāṃstvaṃ jahi mā vyathiṣṭhā yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān
en: Now that you know you have already conquered your enemies in this war, you must be confident. With this confidence, you should not waver in performing your duty, which is to stand and destroy those brave warriors Dron, Bheeshm, Jaidrath, Karn, and the others. You should not fear at all, for I have already killed them. It is certain that you will conquer.

sa:
. संजय उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी ।
नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य ॥
tl:
. saṃjaya uvāca etacchrutvā vacanaṃ keśavasya kṛtāñjalirvepamānaḥ
kirīṭī namaskṛtvā bhūya evāha kṛṣṇaṃ sagadgadaṃ bhītabhītaḥ praṇamya
en:
Sanjay said:
Having heard Shri Krishn, Arjun joined his palms and, trembling with fear, bowed before the Lord. As he spoke, his tongue faltered.

sa:
. अर्जुन उवाच स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च ।
रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसंघाः ॥
tl:
. arjuna uvāca sthāne hṛṣīkeśa tava prakīrtyā jagatprahṛṣyatyanurajyate
ca rakṣāṃsi bhītāni diśo dravanti sarve namasyanti ca siddhasaṃghāḥ
en:
Arjun said:
While the universe lovingly enjoys the chanting of Your names, virtues, and glories, and all the siddhas pray to You, while terrified demons flee in all directions, I see that these are all Your own manifestations.

sa:
. कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे ।
अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत् ॥
tl:
. kasmācca te na nameranmahātman garīyase
brahmaṇo’pyādikartre ananta deveśa jagannivāsa tvamakṣaraṃ sadasattatparaṃ yat
en: O great One, why should all not bow to You? You are the Creator of creators, the greatest of the great. You are the abode of the universe. You are everything, existent and non-existent. O infinite Lord of celestials, You are, in fact, beyond both. You are the indestructible essence, Brahm.

sa:
. त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराण- स्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् ।
वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप ॥
tl:
. tvamādidevaḥ puruṣaḥ purāṇa- stvamasya viśvasya paraṃ nidhānam
vettāsi vedyaṃ ca paraṃ ca dhāma tvayā tataṃ viśvamanantarūpa
en: I have seen You as the Primal Being, the most ancient One, the ultimate and last resort of the universe. You are the knower, the knowable, the highest abode of all. You alone pervade the universe just by assuming endless forms.

sa:
. वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च ।
नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते ॥
tl:
. vāyuryamo’gnirvaruṇaḥ śaśāṅkaḥ prajāpatistvaṃ prapitāmahaśca namo
namaste’stu sahasrakṛtvaḥ punaśca bhūyo’pi namo namaste
en: O Lord, You are the god of wind, the god of death, the god of fire, the god of the moon, the Lord of creation; You are, indeed, the very originator of Brahmaa, the Creator. Salutations to You, repeated salutations to You, a thousand times, again and again.

sa:
. नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व ।
अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः ॥
tl:
. namaḥ purastādatha pṛṣṭhataste namo’stu te sarvata
eva sarva anantavīryāmitavikramastvaṃ sarvaṃ samāpnoṣi tato’si sarvaḥ
en: O Lord of infinite glories, on every side I offered my salutations to You whom I now see present everywhere as one substance, one glory, one Lord, all-pervading, possessor of infinite might.

sa:
. सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति ।
अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि ॥
tl:
. sakheti matvā prasabhaṃ yaduktaṃ he kṛṣṇa he
yādava he sakheti ajānatā mahimānaṃ tavedaṃ mayā pramādātpraṇayena vāpi
en: Now, O Lord Krishn, purity of all purities, I seek Your forgiveness for my behaviour, for the manner in which, through intimacy or want of thought, I have called You my friend, for having joked with You, and for sometimes having insulted You while we were playing, reposing, sitting, or eating, alone, and even in the presence of others. I pray to You, O infinite Lord, forgive me.

sa:
यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु ।
एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम् ॥
tl: yaccāvahāsārthamasatkṛto’si vihāraśayyāsanabhojaneṣu eko’thavāpyacyuta tatsamakṣaṃ tatkṣāmaye tvāmahamaprameyam
en: Now, O Lord Krishn, purity of all purities, I seek Your forgiveness for my behaviour, for the manner in which, through intimacy or want of thought, I have called You my friend, for having joked with You, and for sometimes having insulted You while we were playing, reposing, sitting, or eating, alone, and even in the presence of others. I pray to You, O infinite Lord, forgive me.

sa:
. पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान् ।
न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकःकुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव ॥
tl:
. pitāsi lokasya carācarasya tvamasya
pūjyaśca gururgarīyān na tvatsamo’styabhyadhikaḥkuto’nyo lokatraye’pyapratimaprabhāva
en: You are the original Father, the Satguru, the original Master of this moving and unmoving creation. O Lord of incomparable might, worthy of all adoration, there is none to equal You in all the three worlds. How then could there be anyone better?

sa:
तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम् ।
पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम् ॥
tl:
tasmātpraṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṃ prasādaye tvāmahamīśamīḍyam piteva
putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum
en: I bow at Your feet and seek Your grace, knowing that You are the Lord of all that exists and are worthy of all praise. Be kind, O Lord, put up with me as a father bears with his son, a friend with his friend, a lover with his beloved.

sa:
. अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे ।
तदेव म दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास ॥
tl:
. adṛṣṭapūrvaṃ hṛṣito’smi dṛṣṭvā bhayena ca pravyathitaṃ mano
me tadeva ma darśaya deva rūpaṃ prasīda deveśa jagannivāsa
en: After seeing Your universal form, which I have never seen before, I truly am transported with joy; but still my mind seems tormented by fear. I pray to You therefore, O Lord of celestials, the very abode of the universe, be kind and show me once again the divine four-armed form of Vishnu.

sa:
. किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्त- मिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव ।
तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते ॥
tl:
. kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakrahasta- micchāmi tvāṃ draṣṭumahaṃ
tathaiva tenaiva rūpeṇa caturbhujena sahasrabāho bhava viśvamūrte
en: I desire to see You adorned with a diadem upon Your head and holding a mace and discus. O Lord of a thousand arms, O Lord of cosmic Being, I pray You to appear again in the four-armed form of Vishnu.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात् ।
तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम् ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṃ rūpaṃ paraṃ
darśitamātmayogāt tejomayaṃ viśvamanantamādyaṃ yanme tvadanyena na dṛṣṭapūrvam
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, since I am pleased with you, I have shown you My cosmic form of supreme effulgence and infinite power. This form, which I revealed through My cosmic power, has never been seen before by anyone.

sa:
. न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानै- र्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः ।
एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर ॥
tl:
. na vedayajñādhyayanairna dānai- rna ca kriyābhirna
tapobhirugraiḥ evaṃrūpaḥ śakya ahaṃ nṛloke draṣṭuṃ tvadanyena kurupravīra
en: Arjun, in this physical world of human beings, I cannot be seen in this form at this moment by anyone but you, even if he has studied the scriptures, performed rituals, actions, and severe penances, or offered gifts. This is because you have reached the culmination of devotion.

sa:
. मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम् ।
व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य ॥
tl:
. mā te vyathā mā ca vimūḍhabhāvo dṛṣṭvā
rūpaṃ ghoramīdṛṅmamedam vyapetabhīḥ prītamanāḥ punastvaṃ tadeva me rūpamidaṃ prapaśya
en: Do not be perplexed by the sight of this dreadful, cosmic form of Mine. Fearless and unperturbed, behold once again My four-armed form and be delighted at heart.

sa:
. संजय उवाच इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः ।
आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर्महात्मा ॥
tl:
. saṃjaya uvāca ityarjunaṃ vāsudevastathoktvā svakaṃ rūpaṃ
darśayāmāsa bhūyaḥ āśvāsayāmāsa ca bhītamenaṃ bhūtvā punaḥ saumyavapurmahātmā
en:
Sanjay said:
Speaking thus, Lord Krishn again showed Arjun His four-armed aspect and, assuming a gentle bearing, consoled the fear-stricken warrior.

sa:
. अर्जुन उवाच दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन ।
इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेताः प्रकृतिं गतः ॥
tl:
. arjuna uvāca dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava
saumyaṃ janārdana idānīmasmi saṃvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ
en:
Arjun said:
Seeing this gentle form of Yours, I have returned to my normal consciousness and again feel composed.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच सुदुर्दर्शमिदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम ।
देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca sudurdarśamidaṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭavānasi
yanmama devā apyasya rūpasya nityaṃ darśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, My four-armed appearance, which you are now seeing, is exceedingly difficult for even the gods to perceive, though they are always eager to behold Me thus.

sa:
. नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया ।
शक्य एवंविधो द्रष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा ॥
tl:
. nāhaṃ vedairna tapasā na dānena na
cejyayā śakya evaṃvidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavānasi māṃ yathā
en: It is because you have become totally one with Me that I have shown you My cosmic form. Even if someone studies the Vedas, performs penances, offers charity, or follows rituals, if he remains in ego consciousness, which means separate from Me, he will not be able to perceive this form of Mine.

sa:
. भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन ।
ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परंतप ॥
tl:
. bhaktyā tvananyayā śakya ahamevaṃvidho’rjuna jñātuṃ
draṣṭuṃ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṃ ca paraṃtapa
en: It was your single-minded devotion that enabled you to see Me in this form. Anyone who reaches the same height of devotion can see Me, and can also know My essence.

sa:
. मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः ।
निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव ॥
tl:
. matkarmakṛnmatparamo madbhaktaḥ saṅgavarjitaḥ nirvairaḥ
sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ sa māmeti pāṇḍava
en:
Arjun, you must know that he who performs all his duties while depending on Me and devoting himself to Me for My sake, who entertains no sense of separateness from Me, who knows that I permeate all beings, and who is free from malice towards them; he becomes united with Me. He attains Me.
The chapter known as Vishwaroop Darshan Yog ends.

sa:
अर्जुन उवाच एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते ।
ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः ॥
tl:
arjuna uvāca evaṃ satatayuktā ye bhaktāstvāṃ
paryupāsate ye cāpyakṣaramavyaktaṃ teṣāṃ ke yogavittamāḥ
en:
Arjun said:
O Krishn, please let me know which worshippers know Yog better: those who devote their minds to constantly remembering You as possessed of forms, names, and qualifications, or those who devote their minds to remembering You as the infinite Existence, the indestructible, unmanifest Brahm.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ।
श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca mayyāveśya mano ye māṃ
nityayuktā upāsate śraddhayā parayopetāste me yuktatamā matāḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, I consider those to be the best who have perfect faith in Me and who are united with Me forever through constantly remembering and knowing Me as the One who alone exists everywhere the same, whether with form or without form.

sa:
. ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते ।
सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम् ॥
tl: . ye tvakṣaramanirdeśyamavyaktaṃ paryupāsate sarvatragamacintyaṃ ca kūṭasthamacalaṃ dhruvam
en: Arjun, they too attain unity with Me in their awareness who regulate all the senses, who develop the power of even-mindedness towards all beings, and who wish all beings well and appreciate them as their own Self, the unthinkable, omnipresent, unmanifest, and changeless Brahm. Such devotees attain the Consciousness of God.

sa:
संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः ।
ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥
tl: saṃniyamyendriyagrāmaṃ sarvatra samabuddhayaḥ te prāpnuvanti māmeva sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ
en: Arjun, they too attain unity with Me in their awareness who regulate all the senses, who develop the power of even-mindedness towards all beings, and who wish all beings well and appreciate them as their own Self, the unthinkable, omnipresent, unmanifest, and changeless Brahm. Such devotees attain the Consciousness of God.

sa:
. क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम् ।
अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते ॥
tl: . kleśo’dhikatarasteṣāmavyaktāsaktacetasām avyaktā hi gatirduḥkhaṃ dehavadbhiravāpyate
en: For those, however, who are centred in and attached fast to their bodies, the strain of uniting with the unmanifest form of My Supreme Being is much greater.

sa:
. ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्पराः ।
अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते ॥
tl:
. ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi
saṃnyasya matparāḥ ananyenaiva yogena māṃ dhyāyanta upāsate
en: Those who have come to know that they exist because of Me do not continue to think of themselves as separate doers. They know that it is due to Me that action takes place; and so with unfailing simplicity they worship Me, knowing Me as God with all attributes and qualifications.

sa:
. तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात् ।
भवामि नचिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम् ॥
tl: . teṣāmahaṃ samuddhartā mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt bhavāmi nacirātpārtha mayyāveśitacetasām
en: I soon give such worshippers the Light of My Knowledge, and with it they come to know that there is only one Self, forever free from the ocean of birth and death. Thus, with their minds forever united with Me, they never become bound.

sa:
. मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय ।
निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः ॥
tl:
. mayyeva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ
niveśaya nivasiṣyasi mayyeva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ
en: Therefore, Arjun, transcend your present awareness of individual consciousness, which causes your Self to become attached to your body as something separate from Me. Establish your intellect in the perfect Knowledge that I alone am the Self, manifesting as all beings. If you do this, your consciousness will undoubtedly abide in Me.

sa:
. अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम् ।
अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनंजय ॥
tl:
. atha cittaṃ samādhātuṃ na śaknoṣi
mayi sthiram abhyāsayogena tato māmicchāptuṃ dhanaṃjaya
en: If you are unable to know Me as the one Self everywhere, then try to attain this Knowledge through the repeated practice of holding Me in your vision as One everywhere.

sa:
. अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव ।
मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥
tl: . abhyāse’pyasamartho’si matkarmaparamo bhava madarthamapi karmāṇi kurvansiddhimavāpsyasi
en: If, however, you become aware that your intellect is incapable of grasping how to carry out the work of following such a practice, then be prepared simply to act and do not exert yourself to understand at the level of your higher Consciousness which knows “I am everywhere.” Just act and dedicate your action to Me, knowing that without Me you cannot perform any action at all.

sa:
. अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः ।
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान् ॥
tl: . athaitadapyaśakto’si kartuṃ madyogamāśritaḥ sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān
en: If you are unable even to practise this technique of selfless action, then you must attempt to grasp from where the idea “I am this body” comes, that is, from where the sense of duality appears. Then, being a non-doer, you will easily relinquish to Me your personal idea of facing the results of the actions you perform. In this way you will attain Me.

sa:
. श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासा- ज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते ।
ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्याग- स्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम् ॥
tl: . śreyo hi jñānamabhyāsā- jjñānāddhyānaṃ viśiṣyate dhyānātkarmaphalatyāga- styāgācchāntiranantaram
en: If your practice of knowing Me as the one Self consists of giving up your actions and indiscriminately adopting various other means, then better to practise knowing who is making you adopt those means, for this, rather than the cessation of action, is what will unfold the Knowledge of Me. To unfold the Knowledge of Me, meditation is better than mere thinking. And, once one has attained this Knowledge gained through meditation, then the fruits of action belong to Me who gives power, life, and motivation to action. Then, meditation is not essential, for if you attain the Knowledge which causes you to give up the results of action, peace immediately follows. At that time, you are attuned to My Consciousness and know that it is Me who is at the back of everyone’s actions. So, all results belong to Me.

sa:
. अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च ।
निर्ममो निरहंकारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी ॥
tl:
. adveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa
eva ca nirmamo nirahaṃkāraḥ samaduḥkhasukhaḥ kṣamī
en: Arjun, that devotee is very dear to Me who is free from jealousy and malice towards other beings, who is free from the selfishness of “I” and “mine,” who is completely balanced while experiencing joy and sorrow, who is by nature forgiving, fulfilled, and content in himself, and who in his mind is forever united with Me, the essential Ultimate Self, the basis of all the states of Self-manifestation. And he is dear who has become perfectly aware that I alone am the light of his mental consciousness. He remains surrendered to Me with the result that he is always friendly and compassionate to all My beings. I cherish his presence.

sa:
संतुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः ।
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥
tl:
saṃtuṣṭaḥ satataṃ yogī yatātmā dṛḍhaniścayaḥ
mayyarpitamanobuddhiryo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
en: Arjun, that devotee is very dear to Me who is free from jealousy and malice towards other beings, who is free from the selfishness of “I” and “mine,” who is completely balanced while experiencing joy and sorrow, who is by nature forgiving, fulfilled, and content in himself, and who in his mind is forever united with Me, the essential Ultimate Self, the basis of all the states of Self-manifestation. And he is dear who has become perfectly aware that I alone am the light of his mental consciousness. He remains surrendered to Me with the result that he is always friendly and compassionate to all My beings. I cherish his presence.

sa:
. यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः ।
हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः ॥
tl:
. yasmānnodvijate loko lokānnodvijate ca yaḥ
harṣāmarṣabhayodvegairmukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
en: Arjun, he is also very dear to Me who never causes annoyance to his fellow creatures, and who is never annoyed by them either. He who is unaffected by delight or envy and who is free from the feelings of disturbance and fear is dear to Me.

sa:
. अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः ।
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः ॥
tl:
. anapekṣaḥ śucirdakṣa udāsīno gatavyathaḥ
sarvārambhaparityāgī yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
en: Arjun, that devotee is also dear who is fulfilled and depends upon nothing for his survival, who is aware on the level of God Consciousness as well as in his individual consciousness that there is one Self, unmixed with any form, pure and independent in itself. He is dear who is so thoroughly aware of Oneness that his consciousness never becomes partial, for he has risen beyond the sense of division, distraction, and the feeling of doership in his undertakings. In other words, he who has renounced the sense of ego, ignorance, or duality is most definitely dear to Me.

sa:
. यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति ।
शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः ॥
tl:
. yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na
śocati na kāṅkṣati śubhāśubhaparityāgī bhaktimānyaḥ sa me priyaḥ
en: Arjun, he is certainly dear to Me who, undisturbed by any happening in the world, is stable in his consciousness, does not desire, rejoice, or feel bad, and, having renounced his identification, is fully devoted to Me.

sa:
. समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः ।
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः ॥
tl:
. samaḥ śatrau ca mitre
ca tathā mānāpamānayoḥ śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅgavivarjitaḥ
en: He who is established in the awareness that friend and foe, heat and cold, honour and dishonour, pleasure and pain are ideas, or forms, of the mind—which is of the one Self—remains free from attachment, the sense of duality which the mind creates.

sa:
. तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी संतुष्टो येन केनचित् ।
अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः ॥
tl:
. tulyanindāstutirmaunī saṃtuṣṭo yena
kenacit aniketaḥ sthiramatirbhaktimānme priyo naraḥ
en: He who maintains a clear distinction between praise and reproach, yet is unaffected by either, who is balanced no matter how nature provides the means of his subsistence, who keeps his awareness united with Me as the Lord and owner of all actions, who is aware that even his dwelling belongs to Me, and who thus keeps thinking about and meditating on Me as his own being; Arjun, he is dear to Me.

sa:
. ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते ।
श्रद्दधाना मत्परमा भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः ॥
tl:
. ye tu dharmyāmṛtamidaṃ yathoktaṃ
paryupāsate śraddadhānā matparamā bhaktāste’tīva me priyāḥ
en:
Arjun, those devotees are extremely dear to Me who, with even mind and complete faith and devotion, drink the nectar of this pious Wisdom which I have set forth.
The chapter known as Bhakti Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते ।
एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetramityabhidhīyate etadyo
vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, the body in which all ideas arise is called the chhaytr, the manifest field, and the one who watches all the happenings in this field is called the Chhaytragya, the Master or the Knower of the field. This is how the sages distinguish between the two.

sa:
. क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत ।
