क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम ॥
tl:
. kṣetrajñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi
sarvakṣetreṣu bhārata kṣetrakṣetrajñayorjñānaṃ yattajjñānaṃ mataṃ mama
en: Arjun, the Knower watching each individual field is My Self, existing as the individual soul, or Chhaytragya, in every field. He who attains the Knowledge of the field and of the Knower of the field is said to have attained Wisdom.

sa:
. तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत् ।
स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे शृणु ॥
tl:
. tatkṣetraṃ yacca yādṛkca yadvikāri yataśca yat
sa ca yo yatprabhāvaśca tatsamāsena me śṛṇu
en: Arjun, listen to Me and I will describe in brief the Knower of the field with His powers, and the field itself with its modifications and its source.

sa:
. ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक् ।
ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चतैः ॥
tl: . ṛṣibhirbahudhā gītaṃ chandobhirvividhaiḥ pṛthak brahmasūtrapadaiścaiva hetumadbhirviniścataiḥ
en: The truth about the field and the Knower of the field has been expressed by sages in many ways. It has been stated in various vaydik mantras and is recorded in the text of that Brahmsutras.

sa:
. महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च ।
इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः ॥
tl:
. mahābhūtānyahaṃkāro buddhiravyaktameva ca
indriyāṇi daśaikaṃ ca pañca cendriyagocarāḥ
en: The following comprise the field, or the body, and are called the modifications of the field: the five mahaabhoot, or elements; the ahankaar, or ego; the buddhi, or intellect; the avyakt, or unmanifest form of matter; the ten instruments in the form of the five perceptive and the five active indriyas, or senses; the eleventh sense, manas, the mind; the five objective fields of the senses such as sound for the ear, sensation for the sense of touch, colour for the vision, taste for the tongue, and smell for the nose; desire, a modification of the mind which includes hope, yearning, and craving; aversion, or antipathy towards something one conceives to be causing pain and pleasure; the physical body; pain; consciousness; and strength in terms of firmness.

sa:
इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं संघातश्चेतना धृतिः ।
एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl:
icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ
saṃghātaścetanā dhṛtiḥ etatkṣetraṃ samāsena savikāramudāhṛtam
en: The following comprise the field, or the body, and are called the modifications of the field: the five mahaabhoot, or elements; the ahankaar, or ego; the buddhi, or intellect; the avyakt, or unmanifest form of matter; the ten instruments in the form of the five perceptive and the five active indriyas, or senses; the eleventh sense, manas, the mind; the five objective fields of the senses such as sound for the ear, sensation for the sense of touch, colour for the vision, taste for the tongue, and smell for the nose; desire, a modification of the mind which includes hope, yearning, and craving; aversion, or antipathy towards something one conceives to be causing pain and pleasure; the physical body; pain; consciousness; and strength in terms of firmness.

sa:
. अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम् ।
आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः ॥
tl: . amānitvamadambhitvamahiṃsā kṣāntirārjavam ācāryopāsanaṃ śaucaṃ sthairyamātmavinigrahaḥ
en: Arjun, be attentive and listen to Me as I describe the qualities which relate to Gyaan, or Knowledge. They are absence of pride, freedom from hypocrisy, total non-violence, forbearance, simple living, directness of speech and mind, devotion to the preceptor, purity, steadiness of mind, mastery over the body, mind, and senses;

sa:
; इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च ।
जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम् ॥
tl: ; indriyārtheṣu vairāgyamanahaṃkāra eva ca janmamṛtyujarāvyādhiduḥkhadoṣānudarśanam
en: Absence of attachment towards the objects of enjoyment in this world and the next, absence of this sense of ego, awareness of the pain and evil inherent in birth, death, old age, and disease;

sa:
; असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु ।
नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु ॥
tl: ; asaktiranabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putradāragṛhādiṣu nityaṃ ca samacittatvamiṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu
en: Absence of the feeling of possession in respect to son, wife, home, and the like, a balanced mind in favorable and unfavorable circumstances;

sa:
; मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी ।
विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि ॥
tl: ; mayi cānanyayogena bhaktiravyabhicāriṇī viviktadeśasevitvamaratirjanasaṃsadi
en: One-pointed devotion to Me through exclusive Knowledge of Me on the level of the mind, living in secluded and holy places, not depending on the company of others for enjoyment;

sa:
; अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम् ।
एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा ॥
tl: ; adhyātmajñānanityatvaṃ tattvajñānārthadarśanam etajjñānamiti proktamajñānaṃ yadato’nyathā
en: And finally, Awareness, or seeing God as the only Reality and true Knowledge. This is Knowledge as I have declared Knowledge to be; that is, the opposite of ignorance, yet inclusive of all sensory knowledge.

sa:
. ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते ।
अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते ॥
tl: . jñeyaṃ yattatpravakṣyāmi yajjñātvāmṛtamaśnute anādimatparaṃ brahma na sattannāsaducyate
en: Arjun, I shall speak to you about that which is to be known and knowing which you will attain the Knowledge of Supreme Bliss. The one known as Supreme Brahm is called by sages the Lord of beginningless entities. It is neither sat, being, nor asat, nonbeing. It is beyond both.

sa:
. सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम् ।
सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति ॥
tl: . sarvataḥ pāṇipādaṃ tatsarvato’kṣiśiromukham sarvataḥ śrutimalloke sarvamāvṛtya tiṣṭhati
en: Since Brahm alone permeates the whole universe, it may be visualized as One, with hands and feet on all sides, ears all around, and eyes, heads, and mouths facing all directions.

sa:
. सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम् ।
असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च ॥
tl: . sarvendriyaguṇābhāsaṃ sarvendriyavivarjitam asaktaṃ sarvabhṛccaiva nirguṇaṃ guṇabhoktṛ ca
en: It is said to be perceiving all sense objects, yet is devoid of all senses. It is called the sustainer of the whole universe, yet, it is free, completely unattached. It is described as the enjoyer of all the tastes evolved by the gunas, the three modes of Prakriti, yet, it is free from any attribute.

sa:
. बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च ।
सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत् ॥
tl:
. bahirantaśca bhūtānāmacaraṃ carameva ca
sūkṣmatvāttadavijñeyaṃ dūrasthaṃ cāntike ca tat
en: Brahm exists within and without all beings and constitutes both animate and inanimate creation. The Pure Consciousness of Brahm is so subtle that it is incomprehensible. It is close at hand, yet stands afar.

sa:
. अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम् ।
भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च ॥
tl:
. avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktamiva ca
sthitam bhūtabhartṛ ca tajjñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
en: Though it appears in all animate and inanimate beings as if divided, in reality it is undivided, like the indivisible aspect of space. It is the Godhead, the Creator of all beings, and at the same time it is their sustainer. It is the destroyer of the forms of all beings at the time of their dissolution, and for you it is the only reality worth knowing.

sa:
. ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते ।
ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम् ॥
tl:
. jyotiṣāmapi tajjyotistamasaḥ paramucyate jñānaṃ
jñeyaṃ jñānagamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
en: Arjun, Brahm, the Supreme Being, is said to be the eternal store of all states of consciousness. It is entirely beyond Maayaa, the Creatrix. It is the Lord who is the Godhead in terms of the Knowledge worth knowing and worth attaining. Its true nature is found seated in the hearts of all.

sa:
. इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः ।
मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते ॥
tl:
. iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ
jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ madbhakta etadvijñāya madbhāvāyopapadyate
en: Arjun, when My devotee, united with My Being, knows that I am chhaytr, the truth of the field, Chhaytragya, the Knower of the field, and Gyaan, the Knowledge in between the two, he is said to have attained Me.

sa:
. प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि ।
विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसंभवान् ॥
tl:
. prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhyanādī
ubhāvapi vikārāṃśca guṇāṃścaiva viddhi prakṛtisaṃbhavān
en: Arjun, so far as the dimension of Purush, Pure Consciousness, and the dimension of Prakriti, Pure Existence, are concerned, both are beginningless. Whatever modifications the three powers of the gunas take in the form of objects, likes, and dislikes, know that all are born of Prakriti; they are one with the Pure Existence.

sa:
. कार्यकरणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते ।
पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते ॥
tl: . kāryakaraṇakartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtirucyate puruṣaḥ sukhaduḥkhānāṃ bhoktṛtve heturucyate
en: Thus, Prakriti is said to be that which brings forth all happenings and all the means of their creation. My Self dwelling within every being as the individual soul is declared to be the cause of the experience of joy and sorrow.

sa:
. पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान् ।
कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु ॥
tl:
. puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi
bhuṅkte prakṛtijānguṇān kāraṇaṃ guṇasaṅgo’sya sadasadyonijanmasu
en: The Purush, or the Self, seated in its nature as the individual soul, senses the objects which manifest through the workings of the three gunas, the agents of Prakriti. The Self associates and identifies with the perceiver of the objects manifested through the gunas, and this identification is responsible for the birth of the soul and the experience of good and evil.

sa:
. उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः ।
परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः ॥
tl:
. upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā
maheśvaraḥ paramātmeti cāpyukto dehe’sminpuruṣaḥ paraḥ
en: The Self, the Spirit dwelling within this body, is always identical with the Supreme Being. It is free from identification with the body and mind. It is the Seer, the Witness, the true Guide, the Lord and supporter of all. As the embodied soul, this Self is called the individual experiencer; as the formless, it is called the Absolute Experiencer.

sa:
. य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह ।
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते ॥
tl:
. ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca
guṇaiḥ saha sarvathā vartamāno’pi na sa bhūyo’bhijāyate
en: He who has grasped the Knowledge of Purush, the Spirit, and Prakriti, which is nature with her three powers working for manifestation, becomes liberated from ignorance even while performing his every duty.

sa:
. ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना ।
अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे ॥
tl:
. dhyānenātmani paśyanti kecidātmānamātmanā
anye sāṃkhyena yogena karmayogena cāpare
en: Some refine their intellects through meditation, and, thus expanded, realize the Supreme Spirit in their hearts. Others unite with that Spirit through observing the disciplines of knowledge and action.

sa:
. अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते ।
तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः ॥
tl:
. anye tvevamajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya
upāsate te’pi cātitarantyeva mṛtyuṃ śrutiparāyaṇāḥ
en: Still others, not possessing a fully developed intellect, worship Me in a way based on whatever they have heard about Me. After rotating through many difficult incarnations until they finally reach the level of developed intellect, they too are able to cross the ocean of this relative existence when they die.

sa:
. यावत्संजायते किंचित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ।
क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥
tl: . yāvatsaṃjāyate kiṃcitsattvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam kṣetrakṣetrajñasaṃyogāttadviddhi bharatarṣabha
en: Arjun, whether the being appearing in manifestation is sentient or insentient, it emanates from the union of Purush and Prakriti, the Chhaytragya and the chhaytr, Spirit and matter.

sa:
. समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम् ।
विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥
tl:
. samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ
parameśvaram vinaśyatsvavinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
en: He sees truly who has attained the Vision of the Supreme Being as indestructible and abiding in all beings, even though they perish.

sa:
. समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम् ।
न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥
tl:
. samaṃ paśyanhi sarvatra samavasthitamīśvaram
na hinastyātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim
en: He who has realized Oneness with the Supreme Being, who permeates all and in whom all exist, attains the vision of immortality and reaches the supreme state.

sa:
. प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः ।
यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति ॥
tl:
. prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni
sarvaśaḥ yaḥ paśyati tathātmānamakartāraṃ sa paśyati
en: He who has realized the fact that all actions are performed solely by Prakriti, or nature, and that the Pure Self remains the Witness Self, the non-doer, has attained the Truth.

sa:
. यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति ।
तत एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा ॥
tl:
. yadā bhūtapṛthagbhāvamekasthamanupaśyati tata eva
ca vistāraṃ brahma saṃpadyate tadā
en: As soon as a man realizes that all the multiple forms of manifest existence have their root in the one Supreme Being who alone projects them into manifestation, he is said to have attained the Truth.

sa:
. अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः ।
शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते ॥
tl: . anāditvānnirguṇatvātparamātmāyamavyayaḥ śarīrastho’pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
en: Arjun, this indestructible, immortal Supreme Being is free from beginning and free from any attribute. Of course, through its power it dwells in the body; but even while the body acts and moves, this Being does nothing, nor does it become involved in the body’s actions.

sa:
. यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते ।
सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते ॥
tl:
. yathā sarvagataṃ saukṣmyādākāśaṃ
nopalipyate sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate
en: Since the Pure Existence of the Self is unqualified, it is unaffected by the body’s attributes, just as the all-pervading aakaash, the sky-space, is never involved with anything simply because it is so subtle.

sa:
. यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः ।
क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत ॥
tl:
. yathā prakāśayatyekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokamimaṃ raviḥ
kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata
en: The Aatmaa, the Self, enlivens the whole field of the body just as the sun illuminates the entire solar system.

sa:
. क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।
भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम् ॥
tl:
. kṣetrakṣetrajñayorevamantaraṃ jñānacakṣuṣā bhūtaprakṛtimokṣaṃ
ca ye viduryānti te param
en:
They reach the eternal Supreme Being who realize the difference between the chhaytr and the Chhaytragya and who know that while all objects take their shape and form from Prakriti, the Self remains forever free.
The chapter known as Chhaytra Chhaytragya Vibhaag Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम् ।
यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca paraṃ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṃ jñānamuttamam
yajjñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṃ siddhimito gatāḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
I shall speak once again about the greatest, the Supreme Wisdom. All who attained this highest perfection were liberated from the binding influence of material existence. They became sages.

sa:
. इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः ।
सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च ॥
tl:
. idaṃ jñānamupāśritya mama sādharmyamāgatāḥ
sarge’pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
en: Those who practice this Wisdom enter into the Truth of My Supreme Being. They become one with Me. They are not born into an unconscious state at the cosmic dawn and they are not disturbed during the cosmic dissolution. They attain the true nature of My free and Supreme Being.

sa:
. मम योनिर्महत् ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम् ।
संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततो भवति भारत ॥
tl:
. mama yonirmahat brahma tasmingarbhaṃ
dadhāmyaham saṃbhavaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ tato bhavati bhārata
en: My first manifest nature is the creative consciousness known as the Creator, Brahmaa, or the Creatrix, Mother Shakti. This is the womb, the beginning of the conception of all creatures. Into that womb of My own power I place the seed, the real idea, containing all the varieties of life. In My Supernature I am the wave of Consciousness and the force of Existence—Purush and Prakriti, Spirit and matter. The creation of all beings issues forth from the union of Purush and Prakriti. Know this fact and hold it in your mind, Arjun.

sa:
. सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः संभवन्ति याः ।
तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता ॥
tl:
. sarvayoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ saṃbhavanti
yāḥ tāsāṃ brahma mahadyonirahaṃ bījapradaḥ pitā
en: Thus, at this level of creation I am the seed-giving Father and the conceiving Mother Nature, from whom embodied beings develop into the various species.

sa:
. सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसंभवाः ।
निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम् ॥
tl:
. sattvaṃ rajastama iti guṇāḥ
prakṛtisaṃbhavāḥ nibadhnanti mahābāho dehe dehinamavyayam
en: By My will, the processing powers of sattwa, rajas, and tamas, indicative of the forces of consciousness, will, and existence, are born into the nature of Prakriti. They immediately interact with one another and create a split in the indivisible Spirit, tying it down to material manifestation. The dividing agent is called the mind of Prakriti.

sa:
. तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम् ।
सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ ॥
tl: . tatra sattvaṃ nirmalatvātprakāśakamanāmayam sukhasaṅgena badhnāti jñānasaṅgena cānagha
en: Of the three forces, sattwa, rajas, and tamas, sattwa is the eternally illuminating and flawless consciousness. It attaches the soul to individuality through identification with joy and wisdom.

sa:
. रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम् ।
तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम् ॥
tl:
. rajo rāgātmakaṃ viddhi
tṛṣṇāsaṅgasamudbhavam tannibadhnāti kaunteya karmasaṅgena dehinam
en: The force of rajas attaches and binds the Pure Spirit to individuality through identification with passion, action, and its fruits.

sa:
. तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम् ।
प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत ॥
tl: . tamastvajñānajaṃ viddhi mohanaṃ sarvadehinām pramādālasyanidrābhistannibadhnāti bhārata
en: The force of tamas attaches the soul to individuality through identification with the material existence of the body. It deludes the soul by causing it to identify its true nature with the nature of the body. Under the influence of tamas, the soul is bound by ignorance; it commits the mistake of forgetting its own Truth, and begins to sleep.

sa:
. सत्त्वं सुखे संजयति रजः कर्मणि भारत ।
ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे संजयत्युत ॥
tl:
. sattvaṃ sukhe saṃjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi
bhārata jñānamāvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde saṃjayatyuta
en: The quality of sattwa creates desire for enjoyment in the individual soul; rajas urges the soul to action; and tamas veils Wisdom and leads the soul into ignorance, sleep, and unconsciousness.

sa:
. रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत ।
रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा ॥
tl:
. rajastamaścābhibhūya sattvaṃ bhavati bhārata
rajaḥ sattvaṃ tamaścaiva tamaḥ sattvaṃ rajastathā
en: When the light of sattwa prevails in the individual soul, the powers of rajas and tamas are overcome. When the power of rajas prevails, sattwa and tamas are overcome. When the delusion of tamas prevails, it overcomes the light of sattwa and the power of rajas.

sa:
. सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते ।
ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्याद्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत ॥
tl:
. sarvadvāreṣu dehe’sminprakāśa upajāyate
jñānaṃ yadā tadā vidyādvivṛddhaṃ sattvamityuta
en: The light of sattwa’s predominance is recognizable in one’s beginning to be aware of his own true nature, for it is the light of sattwa which illumines the darkness of the individual soul and leads it to Knowledge.

sa:
. लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा ।
रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ ॥
tl:
. lobhaḥ pravṛttirārambhaḥ karmaṇāmaśamaḥ
spṛhā rajasyetāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha
en: One can recognize the preponderance of rajas by the onset of greed and the undertaking of action with interested motives. Along with these signs appear restlessness and the craving for enjoyment.

sa:
. अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च ।
तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन ॥
tl:
. aprakāśo’pravṛttiśca pramādo moha eva
ca tamasyetāni jāyante vivṛddhe kurunandana
en: And, Arjun, when forgetfulness of the purpose of one’s duty begins, frivolity, darkness, and unconsciousness overpower the soul, and the mind and senses lead it towards the bondage, attachment, and pain of tamas.

sa:
. यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत् ।
तदोत्तमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥
tl:
. yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu
pralayaṃ yāti dehabhṛt tadottamavidāṃ lokānamalānpratipadyate
en: When the light of sattwa abounds in the soul, the soul becomes stainless, free from sin; and when its body disintegrates, it attains the heavenly state of the men of noble deeds.

sa:
. रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते ।
तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते ॥
tl:
. rajasi pralayaṃ gatvā karmasaṅgiṣu
jāyate tathā pralīnastamasi mūḍhayoniṣu jāyate
en: When one dies with rajas predominant, he takes birth among those who are attached to action. When he dies with tamas predominant, he is born into a species of stupid creatures such as insects or beasts.

sa:
. कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम् ।
रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम् ॥
tl:
. karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṃ nirmalaṃ
phalam rajasastu phalaṃ duḥkhamajñānaṃ tamasaḥ phalam
en: If a man performs righteous actions, the reward is sattwik and he enjoys it in the shape of joy, wisdom, and detachment. The fruit of action performed under the influence of rajas is sorrow, and the fruit of action performed under the influence of tamas is utter ignorance.

sa:
. सत्त्वात्संजायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च ।
प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च ॥
tl:
. sattvātsaṃjāyate jñānaṃ rajaso lobha
eva ca pramādamohau tamaso bhavato’jñānameva ca
en: Arjun, sattwa is the source from which wisdom flows; rajas is the cause of greed; and the cause of obstinate error, stupidity, and ignorance is tamas.

sa:
. ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः ।
जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः ॥
tl:
. ūrdhvaṃ gacchanti sattvasthā madhye
tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ jaghanyaguṇavṛttisthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ
en: Those who love to abide in the quality of sattwa move upward in their evolution; those who prefer to be close to rajas stay in the middle; and those who cherish the temperament of tamas sink even lower than they already are.

sa:
. नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति ।
गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति ॥
tl:
. nānyaṃ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṃ yadā
draṣṭānupaśyati guṇebhyaśca paraṃ vetti madbhāvaṃ so’dhigacchati
en: The seer, perceiving that the world is the creation of the three agents, sattwa, rajas, and tamas, transcends their influence and realizes Me, the Supreme Being, who stands totally uninvolved and free from the gunas. He reaches Me.

sa:
. गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान् ।
जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैर्विमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते ॥
tl: . guṇānetānatītya trīndehī dehasamudbhavān janmamṛtyujarāduḥkhairvimukto’mṛtamaśnute
en: Having transcended the influence of the three gunas, which are the cause of material existence, the soul attains the Supreme Bliss of My true nature. He becomes a free being, is never bound in the wheel of birth and death, and never suffers the pain of old age.

sa:
. अर्जुन उवाच कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो ।
किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते ॥
tl:
. arjuna uvāca kairliṅgaistrīnguṇānetānatīto
bhavati prabho kimācāraḥ kathaṃ caitāṃstrīnguṇānativartate
en:
Arjun asked:
Tell me, Lord, how does one rise beyond the three gunas, and, reaching there, how does he act? What are the marks of such a man?

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव ।
न द्वेष्टि संप्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca prakāśaṃ ca pravṛttiṃ ca mohameva ca
pāṇḍava na dveṣṭi saṃpravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati
en:
Shri Krishn replied:
Arjun, when one attains the consciousness by which he knows that creation manifests due to the light of sattwa, the force of rajas, and the attachment of tamas, and when he knows the Truth of My Supreme Being, he is said to have transcended the level of the three gunas.

sa:
. उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते ।
गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते ॥
tl:
. udāsīnavadāsīno guṇairyo na vicālyate
guṇā vartanta ityeva yo’vatiṣṭhati neṅgate
en: He is said to have transcended the gunas who keeps sitting as the Witness Self, totally uninvolved, undisturbed by the powers of the gunas, and fully aware that in this world there are only the forces of the gunas interacting with each other in the form of objects, things, and persons. He remains forever established in identity with God Consciousness and never falls from this supreme state.

sa:
. समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ।
तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः ॥
tl: . samaduḥkhasukhaḥ svasthaḥ samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ tulyapriyāpriyo dhīrastulyanindātmasaṃstutiḥ
en: The mark of such an established being is that he remains balanced at the time of pain or happiness and holds to the Vision of Oneness, which sees a clod of earth, a stone, and a piece of gold as simply the manifest forms of the Supreme Being. He is even-minded, attaches neither more nor less importance to things, and always maintains that wisdom which knows the nature and use of a clod of earth, a stone, and a piece of gold. To him, neither censure nor praise are any disturbance at all.

sa:
. मानापमानयोस्तुल्यस्तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः ।
सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते ॥
tl: . mānāpamānayostulyastulyo mitrāripakṣayoḥ sarvārambhaparityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa ucyate
en: He is neutral towards honour and dishonour, and he holds to the Vision of Oneness, which keeps him aware that both a friend and an enemy have their source in the same Pure Spirit. Since he has become aware that the mind is the product of the three gunas, he does not hold any sense of doership in his mind while undertaking action.

sa:
. मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते ।
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
tl:
. māṃ ca yo’vyabhicāreṇa
bhaktiyogena sevate sa guṇānsamatītyaitānbrahmabhūyāya kalpate
en: Arjun, he who has transcended the three gunas is eligible to attain the state of Supreme Brahm by constant worship of Me through exclusive devotion, or one-pointedness.

sa:
. ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च ।
शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च ॥
tl:
. brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāhamamṛtasyāvyayasya ca
śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca
en:
He becomes immortal and blissful, completely free from the pain of birth and death, for I am imperishable, immutable, immortal, eternal Bliss. United with Me, he becomes Me.
The chapter known as Gunatray Vibhaag Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम् ।
छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca ūrdhvamūlamadhaḥśākhamaśvatthaṃ prāhuravyayam chandāṃsi yasya
parṇāni yastaṃ veda sa vedavit
en:
Shri Krishn said:
He who understands this created universe to be like the indestructible peepal tree is said to know the Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, Pure Bliss, the Vayd, or God. The roots of this cosmic tree project upwards as they grow in the ultimate ground of the Supreme Being. Its stem is Brahmaa, the Creator; and its leaves are the Vedas, the various parts of experience as they are drawn from every level of form. Arjun, an ordinary human being has no ability to understand how creation issues from the Supreme Being, so I have given you this example of the long-living peepal tree.

sa:
. अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः ।
अधश्च मूलान्यनुसंततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके ॥
tl:
. adhaścordhvaṃ prasṛtāstasya śākhā guṇapravṛddhā
viṣayapravālāḥ adhaśca mūlānyanusaṃtatāni karmānubandhīni manuṣyaloke
en: This tree of creation receives nourishment from the three gunas, and man, who is one of the fruits of this tree, receives his nourishment through the sense objects. The branches extending downwards and upwards are the different orders or laws of creation. The roots binding this tree together with the help of its essence, the soul, take their nourishment from the ultimate ground, the Supreme Being. And the beauty of this tree is that it has one, real idea-seed which contains all the species with their different forms, so that on the level of the tree’s fruit there is not just one but multiple forms and phenomena. Thus, the whole of creation is one Reality. The various modes and channels of drawing energy from the atmosphere are the leaves of this tree. In reality, Arjun, this tree has no inside or outside. It has emerged from the one Supreme Existence and has developed through the succession of time and space relationships into that same Pure Existence. Since it is man’s experience that a tree comes out of the ground and spreads itself into the one pervading atmosphere, this example of a tree helps him grasp the nature of creation.

sa:
. न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च संप्रतिष्ठा ।
अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूल- मसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा ॥
tl:
. na rūpamasyeha tathopalabhyate nānto na cādirna
ca saṃpratiṣṭhā aśvatthamenaṃ suvirūḍhamūla- masaṅgaśastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā
en: When a man wants to know the nature of the tree of creation as it presents itself to his mind, he cannot grasp it because this tree has no beginning, no end, no stability anywhere. One must, therefore, take the idea that this tree is separate from the Pure Existence and cut this idea away from its firmly grounded roots with the power of awareness called dispassion or detachment.

sa:
. ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः ।
तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी ॥
tl:
. tataḥ padaṃ tatparimārgitavyaṃ yasmingatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥ
tameva cādyaṃ puruṣaṃ prapadye yataḥ pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī
en: One should diligently seek information regarding the ultimate ground from which the tree manifests. If one meditates on the Supreme Existence of this manifest tree of creation, he will attain the Knowledge of the ultimate ground and will never again fall into ignorance regarding the nature of creation. He will come to know that he is one with the Primal Being, the Pure Existence of God.

sa:
. निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः ।
द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञै- र्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत् ॥
tl:
. nirmānamohā jitasaṅgadoṣā adhyātmanityā vinivṛttakāmāḥ
dvandvairvimuktāḥ sukhaduḥkhasaṃjñai- rgacchantyamūḍhāḥ padamavyayaṃ tat
en: Those who have become free from the sense of otherness, pride, and delusion, whose desires and cravings are finished, who are uninfluenced by the pairs of opposites such as pain and pleasure, who have gained the state of detachment, and who have become united with their own true nature, the eternal Supreme Being; they attain the immortal state of Pure Existence.

sa:
. न तद्भासयते सूर्यो न शशाङ्को न पावकः ।
यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥
tl:
. na tadbhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na
pāvakaḥ yadgatvā na nivartante taddhāma paramaṃ mama
en: Arjun, My supreme state of Existence cannot be illumined by sun, moon, or the flame of fire because these are My creations and I shine with My own Self-effulgence. Those who attain union with My Self never become forgetful of their true nature, which is Me.

sa:
. ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः ।
मनः षष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति ॥
tl:
. mamaivāṃśo jīvaloke jīvabhūtaḥ
sanātanaḥ manaḥ ṣaṣṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛtisthāni karṣati
en: So far as the eternal jeevaatmaa, the embodied soul within man, is concerned, it is My own Being. It is an individual particle of Me and gathers around itself the spaces of mind and the five senses, which manifest through the workings of the three gunas.

sa:
. शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः ।
गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुर्गन्धानिवाशयात् ॥
tl: . śarīraṃ yadavāpnoti yaccāpyutkrāmatīśvaraḥ gṛhītvaitāni saṃyāti vāyurgandhānivāśayāt
en: As a breeze leaves fragrances behind it, so the jeevaatmaa leaves behind the burden of body, mind, and senses when it departs this physical life and migrates to the other side, from where it will take up a new body with mind and senses.

sa:
. श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च ।
अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते ॥
tl:
. śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṃ ca
rasanaṃ ghrāṇameva ca adhiṣṭhāya manaścāyaṃ viṣayānupasevate
en: As long as the jeevaatmaa associates with the mind and the senses of hearing, sight, touch, taste, and smell, it enjoys the experiences contained in the objects of the senses.

sa:
. उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम् ।
विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः ॥
tl:
. utkrāmantaṃ sthitaṃ vāpi bhuñjānaṃ
vā guṇānvitam vimūḍhā nānupaśyanti paśyanti jñānacakṣuṣaḥ
en: Those who worry are not aware of the fact that it is the jeevaatmaa which experiences the objects of the senses and that when the time comes, it leaves the body and senses and crosses to the other side. Those who see with the eye of Wisdom are aware of this fact and do not worry.

sa:
. यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ।
यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः ॥
tl: . yatanto yoginaścainaṃ paśyantyātmanyavasthitam yatanto’pyakṛtātmāno nainaṃ paśyantyacetasaḥ
en: Those who make an effort to realize the jeevaatmaa as the Pure Light of Consciousness enshrined in the heart-space, which, too, is nothing but the same Pure Consciousness, also become able to realize this fact; but the ignorant, whose hearts and minds have not been purified and expanded, do not know the jeevaatmaa as the Pure Light, even though they try their best.

sa:
. यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम् ।
यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्तेजो विद्धि मामकम् ॥
tl:
. yadādityagataṃ tejo jagadbhāsayate’khilam
yaccandramasi yaccāgnau tattejo viddhi māmakam
en: Arjun, the light dwelling within the heart of the sun illumining the entire solar system is My Light. And the light which shines in the moon and the light which shines in fire are My Light. All is My Light. It is one Light.

sa:
. गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा ।
पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः ॥
tl:
. gāmāviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmyahamojasā
puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
en: Arjun, I permeate the field of existence referred to by the word “soil.” Thus, it is I who support all creatures, and I accomplish this through My life-force. Through the essence of the moon, I shower grace on all plants and nourish them.

sa:
. अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः ।
प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम् ॥
tl:
. ahaṃ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā
prāṇināṃ dehamāśritaḥ prāṇāpānasamāyuktaḥ pacāmyannaṃ caturvidham
en: It is I, Arjun, who infuse Myself as fire in the bodies of all creatures. It is I who unite My ingoing and outgoing life-forces, praan and apaan. And it is I who breathe these forces in and out and maintain their existence.

sa:
. सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि संनिविष्टो मत्तः स्मृतिर्ज्ञानमपोहनं च ।
वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम् ॥
tl:
. sarvasya cāhaṃ hṛdi saṃniviṣṭo mattaḥ
smṛtirjñānamapohanaṃ ca vedaiśca sarvairahameva vedyo vedāntakṛdvedavideva cāham
en: It is I, Arjun, seated in the hearts of all creatures, who am their inner controller, and it is I who am the source of their memory, knowledge, and rational faculties. Once again I tell you, Realization of Me through this Knowledge, which from time to time I have revealed in the Vedas, is man’s only purpose. I alone am the source of Vedant, and at the same time I am the knower of the Vedas.

sa:
. द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च ।
क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते ॥
tl:
. dvāvimau puruṣau loke kṣaraścākṣara eva
ca kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho’kṣara ucyate
en: Arjun, there are two kinds of beings in this world: the perishable and the imperishable. All bodies are said to be perishable, but the embodied soul, the Pure Knower, is forever imperishable.

sa:
. उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः ।
यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः ॥
tl: . uttamaḥ puruṣastvanyaḥ paramātmetyudāhṛtaḥ yo lokatrayamāviśya bibhartyavyaya īśvaraḥ
en: The Supreme Being, the Uttam Purush, who is the Supreme Soul, has entered all the three worlds and upholds and maintains them. He is the imperishable Lord and has been given the names Supreme Being, Supreme Soul, Supreme Consciousness, or Perfect Awareness.

sa:
. यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः ।
अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः ॥
tl:
. yasmātkṣaramatīto’hamakṣarādapi cottamaḥ ato’smi
loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
en: Since I as the Supreme Being permeate all of the perishable world of matter, am all imperishable souls, and yet remain completely uninvolved because of My unique nature, I am known in the world and in the Vedas as Purushottam, the Supreme Lord.

sa:
. यो मामेवमसंमूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम् ।
स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत ॥
tl:
. yo māmevamasaṃmūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam
sa sarvavidbhajati māṃ sarvabhāvena bhārata
en: Arjun, he who realizes Me as Purushottam, the Supreme Reality, the all-permeating, immortal, forever free Existence, constantly worships Me with his entire being; that is, he remains united with Me in his identity.

sa:
. इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ ।
एतत् बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत ॥
tl:
. iti guhyatamaṃ śāstramidamuktaṃ
mayānagha etat buddhvā buddhimānsyātkṛtakṛtyaśca bhārata
en:
Arjun, these teachings that I have imparted to you are most esoteric. It is definite that any man who grasps their essence will become wise; his purpose and mission in this present life are then fulfilled.
The chapter known as Purushottam Yog ends.

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः ।
दानं दमश्चयज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ॥
tl: śrībhagavānuvāca abhayaṃ sattvasaṃśuddhirjñānayogavyavasthitiḥ dānaṃ damaścayajñaśca svādhyāyastapa ārjavam
en:
Shri Krishn said:
Arjun, I will tell you the qualities of the godly man. They are fearlessness, purity of mind, stability in the Knowledge of the Self, charity, mastery over the senses, devotion to God, study of the teachings regarding Self Knowledge, ability to remain free from hardships, truthfulness in the use of the mind and senses;

sa:
; अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् ।
दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ॥
tl: ; ahiṃsā satyamakrodhastyāgaḥ śāntirapaiśunam dayā bhūteṣvaloluptvaṃ mārdavaṃ hrīracāpalam
en: Perfect non-violence, honesty, absence of anger, surrender of the sense of doership, peacefulness, abstinence from abuse, compassion towards all, non-attachment to objects on the level of the mind and senses, gentleness, non-violation of truthful injunctions, abstinence from mean pursuits;

sa:
; तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता ।
भवन्ति संपदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ॥
tl:
; tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucamadroho
nātimānitā bhavanti saṃpadaṃ daivīmabhijātasya bhārata
en: Purification of the personality, forgiveness, fortitude, purity, enmity towards none, and freedom from pride. All these are the qualities and marks of one endowed with the divine nature.

sa:
. दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च ।
अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ संपदमासुरीम् ॥
tl:
. dambho darpo’bhimānaśca krodhaḥ pāruṣyameva
ca ajñānaṃ cābhijātasya pārtha saṃpadamāsurīm
en: Arjun, now listen to the description of the demonic qualities of man. Hypocrisy, arrogance, pride, anger, roughness, and ignorance constitute the nature of one born with demonic tendencies.

sa:
. दैवी संपद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता ।
मा शुचः संपदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ॥
tl:
. daivī saṃpadvimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā
mā śucaḥ saṃpadaṃ daivīmabhijāto’si pāṇḍava
en: The divine nature is conducive to liberation and the demonic causes bondage. Arjun, since you were endowed with the divine temperament at birth, you should not worry at all. You will be united with your true Self.

sa:
. द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च ।
दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ॥
tl:
. dvau bhūtasargau loke’smindaiva āsura eva ca
daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṃ pārtha me śṛṇu
en: Arjun, depending upon their qualities, men are either divine or demonic. Now listen to My description of the men of demonic nature.

sa:
. प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः ।
न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ॥
tl:
. pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca janā na vidurāsurāḥ
na śaucaṃ nāpi cācāro na satyaṃ teṣu vidyate
en: Men with demonic propensities do not know what right action is. Thus, their conduct is neither pure nor truthful.

sa:
. असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् ।
अपरस्परसंभूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ॥
tl: . asatyamapratiṣṭhaṃ te jagadāhuranīśvaram aparasparasaṃbhūtaṃ kimanyatkāmahaitukam
en: Men of demonic nature always say that the foundation of this world has no reality or truth. On this basis, they declare that there is no truth of God anywhere; rather, their ultimate conception is that this world is brought forth by the union of the male and female. Thus, they conceive this world to have been manifested for the sake of lust.

sa:
. एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः ।
प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ॥
tl: . etāṃ dṛṣṭimavaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno’lpabuddhayaḥ prabhavantyugrakarmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato’hitāḥ
en: These semi-intelligent men have lost the Knowledge of their real Self and maintain the false view that there is no true Self at all. They cling to the body’s existence, calling it the only reality. They perform terrible deeds, become the enemies of mankind, and finally prove themselves to be capable only of destroying the world.

sa:
. काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः ।
मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ॥
tl: . kāmamāśritya duṣpūraṃ dambhamānamadānvitāḥ mohādgṛhītvāsadgrāhānpravartante’śucivratāḥ
en: Filled with hypocrisy, pride, arrogance, and insatiable in their longings, these men remain attached to their ignorance, preach false doctrines, and so keep moving in the world.

sa:
. चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः ।
कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ॥
tl: . cintāmaparimeyāṃ ca pralayāntāmupāśritāḥ kāmopabhogaparamā etāvaditi niścitāḥ
en: They are always worried. Their activities always lead towards the enjoyment of sensual pleasure because their concept is that through the pleasures of the senses, they will obtain the highest joy. They work hard throughout their lives and finally meet a dead-end without having gained success.

sa:
. आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः ।
ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ॥
tl: . āśāpāśaśatairbaddhāḥ kāmakrodhaparāyaṇāḥ īhante kāmabhogārthamanyāyenārthasañcayān
en: Men of demonic nature are terribly bound by their hundreds of desires, hopes, and expectations. They give themselves up to lust and anger and are always striving to amass more and more wealth by any unfair means and to remain busy enjoying sensual pleasures.

sa:
. इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् ।
इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ॥
tl:
. idamadya mayā labdhamimaṃ prāpsye
manoratham idamastīdamapi me bhaviṣyati punardhanam
en: They rest satisfied as they are, making themselves believe that having secured enough for the time being they will now be able to realize their highest ambitions. They think, “I have already earned a lot of wealth, and I will earn much more in the future.”

sa:
असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि ।
ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ॥
tl:
asau mayā hataḥ śatrurhaniṣye
cāparānapi īśvaro’hamahaṃ bhogī siddho’haṃ balavānsukhī
en: Arjun, the man of demonic nature is always proud of his strength. He boasts of having finished off many of his enemies and keeps hoping to kill off many more because he entertains the idea that he is the lord of all, enjoying all power at his command. He thinks he possesses supernatural powers and believes himself to be the mightiest and the happiest of all men.

sa:
. आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया ।
यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ॥
tl:
. āḍhyo’bhijanavānasmi ko’nyo’sti sadṛśo
mayā yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣya ityajñānavimohitāḥ
en: The man of demonic nature boasts of his wealth and large family and thinks himself to be the only one who is so prosperous. He keeps saying he will offer sacrifices to the gods, but he never does; he will give charity and alms to the poor, but he never gives; he will be happy forever, but he never is. He is blinded by ignorance, delusion, and lust, and spends all his life enjoying sensual pleasures. His mind is bewildered by the great number of its stray thoughts, and ultimately he falls into terrible hell.

sa:
अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः ।
प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ॥
tl: anekacittavibhrāntā mohajālasamāvṛtāḥ prasaktāḥ kāmabhogeṣu patanti narake’śucau
en: The man of demonic nature boasts of his wealth and large family and thinks himself to be the only one who is so prosperous. He keeps saying he will offer sacrifices to the gods, but he never does; he will give charity and alms to the poor, but he never gives; he will be happy forever, but he never is. He is blinded by ignorance, delusion, and lust, and spends all his life enjoying sensual pleasures. His mind is bewildered by the great number of its stray thoughts, and ultimately he falls into terrible hell.

sa:
. आत्मसंभाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः ।
यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ॥
tl: . ātmasaṃbhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhanamānamadānvitāḥ yajante nāmayajñaiste dambhenāvidhipūrvakam
en: If men of demonic nature worship God at all, they do so just for show, for they are intoxicated by the idea of possessing wealth and honour. Conceited and haughty, they cannot worship God with purity.

sa:
. अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः ।
मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ॥
tl:
. ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ
krodhaṃ ca saṃśritāḥ māmātmaparadeheṣu pradviṣanto’bhyasūyakāḥ
en: Men of demonic nature are given over to egoism, animal force, arrogance, lust, and anger. They are totally attached to their own bodies and to other relations, and they hate Me terribly.

sa:
. तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् ।
क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ॥
tl: . tānahaṃ dviṣataḥ krūrānsaṃsāreṣu narādhamān kṣipāmyajasramaśubhānāsurīṣveva yoniṣu
en: Arjun, men of demonic nature are filled with hate. They are sinful, cruel, and the worst of men. Again and again, I throw them into demonic wombs in this world.

sa:
. आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि ।
मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेयततोयान्त्यधमांगतिम् ॥
tl: . āsurīṃ yonimāpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani māmaprāpyaiva kaunteyatatoyāntyadhamāṃgatim
en: Arjun, these ignorant souls keep going round and round in the wheel of birth and death. They take birth in demonic species and, later, sink to still lower planes. They do not reach Me.

sa:
. त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः ।
कामःक्रोधस्तथालोभस्तस्मादेतत् त्रयं त्यजेत् ॥
tl: . trividhaṃ narakasyedaṃ dvāraṃ nāśanamātmanaḥ kāmaḥkrodhastathālobhastasmādetat trayaṃ tyajet
en: He who has become free from the bondage of desire, anger, and greed, which are the three gates of hell, works to attain his own salvation and ultimately reaches the supreme goal.

sa:
. एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः ।
आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥
tl:
. etairvimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvāraistribhirnaraḥ
ācaratyātmanaḥ śreyastato yāti parāṃ gatim
en: Arjun, this triple gate of hell—desire, anger, and greed—distracts the soul. One should, therefore, become free from these three hellish doors.

sa:
. यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः ।
न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ॥
tl:
. yaḥ śāstravidhimutsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ na
sa siddhimavāpnoti na sukhaṃ na parāṃ gatim
en: He who casts aside the teachings of the Truth as I have spoken them and as they have been recorded in the scriptures, and who acts according to the conditions of his own mind, attains neither perfection nor happiness, and he certainly does not attain the supreme goal.

sa:
. तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ ।
ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥
tl:
. tasmācchāstraṃ pramāṇaṃ te
kāryākāryavyavasthitau jñātvā śāstravidhānoktaṃ karma kartumihārhasi
en:
Therefore, Arjun, these truthful teachings alone are to be your guide in determining what should and what should not be done. Know this and perform right action as ordained by authentic scriptures.
The chapter known as Daivaasur Sampad Vibhaag Yog ends.

sa:
अर्जुन उवाच ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः ।
तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ॥
tl:
arjuna uvāca ye śāstravidhimutsṛjya yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ
teṣāṃ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvamāho rajastamaḥ
en:
Arjun asked:
O Krishn, in terms of sattwa, rajas, and tamas, in what category do they fall who, endowed with faith, worship the gods but do not care about the injunctions of the scriptures?

sa:
श्रीभगवानुवाच त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा ।
सत्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ॥
tl:
śrībhagavānuvāca trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṃ sā svabhāvajā
sattvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṃ śṛṇu
en:
Shri Krishn replied:
Arjun, the faith of man which is innate but not yet developed through the study of scriptures is of three kinds: sattwik, raajsik, and taamsik. Please listen and I will tell you about them.

sa:
. सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत ।
श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ॥
tl:
. sattvānurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata
śraddhāmayo’yaṃ puruṣo yo yacchraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
en: Man’s mental constitution determines the nature of his faith; and whatever the nature of a man’s faith, that is the type of man he is.

sa:
. यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः ।
प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ॥
tl:
. yajante sāttvikā devānyakṣarakṣāṃsi
rājasāḥ pretānbhūtagaṇāṃścānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
en: A man who worships the gods is said to have sattwik faith. He is of raajsik faith who worships demons or demigods. A man of taamsik nature worships ghosts and the dead.

sa:
. अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः ।
दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ॥
tl:
. aśāstravihitaṃ ghoraṃ tapyante
ye tapo janāḥ dambhāhaṃkārasaṃyuktāḥ kāmarāgabalānvitāḥ
en: Arjun, there are those who of their own will undergo hard penances but do not abide by the teachings of the scriptures. They are possessed by hypocrisy and egoism and obsessed by desire, attachment, and pride. They weaken the power of their bodies and pay no attention to Me, the Supreme Spirit dwelling in their hearts. Know these unconscious people to have the raajsik faith of a demonic nature.

sa:
कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः ।
मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ॥
tl: karṣayantaḥ śarīrasthaṃ bhūtagrāmamacetasaḥ māṃ caivāntaḥśarīrasthaṃ tānviddhyāsuraniścayān
en: Arjun, there are those who of their own will undergo hard penances but do not abide by the teachings of the scriptures. They are possessed by hypocrisy and egoism and obsessed by desire, attachment, and pride. They weaken the power of their bodies and pay no attention to Me, the Supreme Spirit dwelling in their hearts. Know these unconscious people to have the raajsik faith of a demonic nature.

sa:
. आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः ।
यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ॥
tl:
. āhārastvapi sarvasya trividho bhavati
priyaḥ yajñastapastathā dānaṃ teṣāṃ bhedamimaṃ śṛṇu
en: Food, the performance of sacrifice, and charity are each of three kinds, Arjun, and each kind suits one of the various natures of man’s mind. Hear me as I distinguish them.

sa:
. आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्य- सुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः ।
रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ॥
tl:
. āyuḥsattvabalārogya- sukhaprītivivardhanāḥ rasyāḥ
snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvikapriyāḥ
en: That food is called sattwik which promotes longevity, intelligence, vigour, health, happiness, and cheerfulness. Its nature is sweet, but not dry; and it is substantial and agreeable. It suits the sattwik type of man.

sa:
. कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः ।
आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ॥
tl: . kaṭvamlalavaṇātyuṣṇatīkṣṇarūkṣavidāhinaḥ āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkhaśokāmayapradāḥ
en: Food which is bitter, acidic, salty, overly hot, pungent, dry, burning, and causes suffering, grief, and disease is called raajsik. It suits the man of raajsik nature.

sa:
. यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् ।
उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ॥
tl:
. yātayāmaṃ gatarasaṃ pūti paryuṣitaṃ
ca yat ucchiṣṭamapi cāmedhyaṃ bhojanaṃ tāmasapriyam
en: Food which is half-cooked, tasteless, rotten, stale, and destructive of purity is taamsik and suits the nature of the taamsik man.

sa:
. अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते ।
यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ॥
tl:
. aphalākāṅkṣibhiryajño vidhidṛṣṭo ya ijyate
yaṣṭavyameveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
en: Arjun, sacrifice, which is the performance of action, is sattwik in character when it is dedicated to God and is performed according to scriptural injunctions without expectation of anything in return.

sa:
. अभिसंधाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् ।
इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ॥
tl:
. abhisaṃdhāya tu phalaṃ dambhārthamapi caiva
yat ijyate bharataśreṣṭha taṃ yajñaṃ viddhi rājasam
en: Sacrifice, or action, which is offered only for the sake of show and with expectation of results is called raajsik, Arjun.

sa:
. विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् ।
श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ॥
tl: . vidhihīnamasṛṣṭānnaṃ mantrahīnamadakṣiṇam śraddhāvirahitaṃ yajñaṃ tāmasaṃ paricakṣate
en: Sacrifice, or offering, which is not performed according to scriptural injunctions, is not supported by food or dakshinaa, money, and is devoid of faith and mantr, is said to be taamsik.

sa:
. देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् ।
ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ॥
tl: . devadvijaguruprājñapūjanaṃ śaucamārjavam brahmacaryamahiṃsā ca śārīraṃ tapa ucyate
en: Tapas, or austerity, is sattwik when one worships gods, spiritually aware persons, elders, and wise men by observing harmlessness, purity, straightforwardness, and continence, and by attuning oneself to Brahm, God.

sa:
. अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् ।
स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ॥
tl:
. anudvegakaraṃ vākyaṃ satyaṃ priyahitaṃ ca
yat svādhyāyābhyasanaṃ caiva vāṅmayaṃ tapa ucyate
en: Tapas of speech is sattwik when it causes no annoyance to others, rather, is agreeable, full of truth, full of the knowledge of the Vedas and other authentic scriptures, and is backed by the practice of jap, the repetition of the divine name.

sa:
. मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः ।
भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ॥
tl: . manaḥprasādaḥ saumyatvaṃ maunamātmavinigrahaḥ bhāvasaṃśuddhirityetattapo mānasamucyate
en: When mental austerity causes cheerfulness and placidity, creates the habit of meditation on God, helps control the mind, and maintains perfect purity of the inner feelings, it is sattwik.

sa:
. श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत् त्रिविधं नरैः ।
अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैःसात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ॥
tl:
. śraddhayā parayā taptaṃ
tapastat trividhaṃ naraiḥ aphalākāṅkṣibhiryuktaiḥsāttvikaṃ paricakṣate
en: Arjun, penance is sattwik when it is performed with supreme faith by a self-disciplined man who expects nothing in return.

sa:
. सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् ।
क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ॥
tl:
. satkāramānapūjārthaṃ tapo dambhena caiva
yat kriyate tadiha proktaṃ rājasaṃ calamadhruvam
en: Arjun, tapas is characterized as raajsik when it is performed ostentatiously for the sake of fame, name, and honour, or for any other selfish gain, yielding only uncertain and momentary fruits.

sa:
. मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः ।
परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl: . mūḍhagrāheṇātmano yatpīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ parasyotsādanārthaṃ vā tattāmasamudāhṛtam
en: Austerity practiced in foolishness, accompanied by self-torture, or performed with the intention of harming others is called taamsik.

sa:
. दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे ।
देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ॥
tl:
. dātavyamiti yaddānaṃ dīyate’nupakāriṇe deśe kāle
ca pātre ca taddānaṃ sāttvikaṃ smṛtam
en: When, out of a sense of duty, a gift is offered to a deserving person in accordance with scriptural injunctions, time, place, and need, it is called sattwik.

sa:
. यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः ।
दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥
tl:
. yattu pratyupakārārthaṃ phalamuddiśya vā punaḥ
dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṃ taddānaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam
en: The gift offered grudgingly and in the hope of receiving service or a reward in return is called raajsik.

sa:
. अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते ।
असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl: . adeśakāle yaddānamapātrebhyaśca dīyate asatkṛtamavajñātaṃ tattāmasamudāhṛtam
en: That gift is called taamsik which is offered in bad grace, in a derisive mood, and without consideration of time, place, or the merit of the recipient.

sa:
. ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः ।
ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ॥
tl:
. ॐ tatsaditi nirdeśo brahmaṇastrividhaḥ
smṛtaḥ brāhmaṇāstena vedāśca yajñāśca vihitāḥ purā
en: Arjun, the Absolute, whose nature is Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, and Pure Bliss, is symbolized by the name Om Tat Sat and is considered to be the source from which the realized sages, the Vedas, and the acts of sacrifice all issued forth at the cosmic dawn.

sa:
. तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः ।
प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ॥
tl: . tasmādomityudāhṛtya yajñadānatapaḥkriyāḥ pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṃ brahmavādinām
en: Therefore, Arjun, charity, austerity according to the sacred precepts of the scriptures, and acts of sacrifice are adopted by those noble souls who recite the Vedic chants and repeat Om, the name of God.

sa:
. तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः ।
दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ॥
tl: . tadityanabhisaṃdhāya phalaṃ yajñatapaḥkriyāḥ dānakriyāśca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣakāṅkṣibhiḥ
en: Holding the idea that everything belongs to God and expecting no return, seekers of blessedness perform acts of sacrifice, austerity, and various kinds of charity while repeating Tat, the name of God.

sa:
. सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते ।
प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ॥
tl:
. sadbhāve sādhubhāve ca sadityetatprayujyate
praśaste karmaṇi tathā sacchabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
en: Sat is the name of God used to mean truth and goodness. It also refers to a praiseworthy act.

sa:
. यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते ।
कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ॥
tl:
. yajñe tapasi dāne ca sthitiḥ
saditi cocyate karma caiva tadarthīyaṃ sadityevābhidhīyate
en: Austerity, charity, truthfulness in sacrifice, and action performed for the sake of God are known by the word Sat.

sa:
. अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् ।
असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ॥
tl:
. aśraddhayā hutaṃ dattaṃ tapastaptaṃ kṛtaṃ ca
yat asadityucyate pārtha na ca tatpretya no iha
en:
Arjun, an offering, a gift, an austerity, even a good deed, when performed without faith, are all termed asat, or naught, and as such are of no avail either here or here-after. Offerings or actions should always be performed with sattwik faith.
The chapter known as Shraddhaa Tray Vibhaag Yog ends.

sa:
अर्जुन उवाच संन्यासस्य महाबाहो तत्त्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् ।
त्यागस्य च हृषीकेश पृथक्केशिनिषूदन ॥
tl:
arjuna uvāca saṃnyāsasya mahābāho tattvamicchāmi
veditum tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthakkeśiniṣūdana
en:
Arjun said:
O mighty-armed Lord Krishn, You are the inner controller of all, You are the slayer of the demon Kayshi, and You are the incarnation of the Supreme Being. I wish to know the truth about sannyaas, renunciation of the ignorance that keeps one bound to forms, and about tyaag, relinquishment of attachment to the fruits of action.

sa:
. श्रीभगवानुवाच काम्यानां कर्मणां न्यासं संन्यासं कवयो विदुः ।
सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं प्राहुस्त्यागं विचक्षणाः ॥
tl:
. śrībhagavānuvāca kāmyānāṃ karmaṇāṃ nyāsaṃ
saṃnyāsaṃ kavayo viduḥ sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ prāhustyāgaṃ vicakṣaṇāḥ
en:
Shri Krishn said:
First, listen to the opinions of the sages. Some understand sannyaas as the giving up of all actions motivated by desire. Some understand tyaag as the relinquishing of the fruits of all action. In both cases the practice of renunciation is adopted.

sa:
. त्याज्यं दोषवदित्येके कर्म प्राहुर्मनीषिणः ।
यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यमिति चापरे ॥
tl:
. tyājyaṃ doṣavadityeke karma
prāhurmanīṣiṇaḥ yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyamiti cāpare
en: Wise men have various opinions on the subject of renunciation. Some say that all actions are faulty and contain some measure of evil, and therefore should be given up. But others say that acts of sattwik sacrifice, charity, and penance are to be performed.

sa:
. निश्चयं शृणु मे तत्र त्यागे भरतसत्तम ।
त्यागो हि पुरुषव्याघ्र त्रिविधः संप्रकीर्तितः ॥
tl:
. niścayaṃ śṛṇu me tatra tyāge
bharatasattama tyāgo hi puruṣavyāghra trividhaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ
en: Now, O mighty Arjun, listen first to My Wisdom concerning tyaag, which is the renunciation of attachment to the fruits of action. It is of three kinds: sattwik, raajsik, and taamsik.

sa:
. यज्ञदानतपःकर्म न त्याज्यं कार्यमेव तत् ।
यज्ञो दानं तपश्चैव पावनानि मनीषिणाम् ॥
tl:
. yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyaṃ kāryameva
tat yajño dānaṃ tapaścaiva pāvanāni manīṣiṇām
en: I say that acts of sattwik sacrifice, charity, and penance should not be given up. They must be performed because all such acts are purifiers of the mind of man.

sa:
. एतान्यपि तु कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा फलानि च ।
कर्तव्यानीति मे पार्थ निश्चितं मतमुत्तमम् ॥
tl:
. etānyapi tu karmāṇi saṅgaṃ tyaktvā
phalāni ca kartavyānīti me pārtha niścitaṃ matamuttamam
en: But, Arjun, My considered and supreme conclusion is that while performing acts of sacrifice, charity, and penance, and all other sattwik acts, the performer should keep his attention on remaining free from the sense of attachment to the fruits of his action.

sa:
. नियतस्य तु संन्यासः कर्मणो नोपपद्यते ।
मोहात्तस्य परित्यागस्तामसः परिकीर्तितः ॥
tl:
. niyatasya tu saṃnyāsaḥ
karmaṇo nopapadyate mohāttasya parityāgastāmasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
en: Actions which are essential and prescribed by the scriptures should not be abandoned. If, due to ignorance, one does give them up, this abandonment is taamsik. It cannot be called tyaag.

sa:
. दुःखमित्येव यत्कर्म कायक्लेशभयात्त्यजेत् ।
स कृत्वा राजसं त्यागं नैव त्यागफलं लभेत् ॥
tl:
. duḥkhamityeva yatkarma kāyakleśabhayāttyajet sa
kṛtvā rājasaṃ tyāgaṃ naiva tyāgaphalaṃ labhet
en: If one gives up worthwhile action from fear of physical strain or discomfort, his renunciation is raajsik. He will not derive any benefit from such renunciation.

sa:
. कार्यमित्येव यत्कर्म नियतं क्रियतेऽर्जुन ।
सङ्गंत्यक्त्वा फलंचैव स त्यागः सात्त्विको मतः ॥
tl:
. kāryamityeva yatkarma niyataṃ kriyate’rjuna
saṅgaṃtyaktvā phalaṃcaiva sa tyāgaḥ sāttviko mataḥ
en: Prescribed action, or duty, is to be performed, but attachment to the fruits of action should be given up. Only such renunciation has been recognized as sattwik.

sa:
. न द्वेष्ट्यकुशलं कर्म कुशले नानुषज्जते ।
त्यागी सत्त्वसमाविष्टो मेधावी छिन्नसंशयः ॥
tl:
. na dveṣṭyakuśalaṃ karma kuśale
nānuṣajjate tyāgī sattvasamāviṣṭo medhāvī chinnasaṃśayaḥ
en: He is a man of true renunciation and intelligence who has removed all his doubts regarding the performance of sattwik action and does not shrink from performing actions which are essential and conducive to blessedness. He is said to have imbibed the quality of goodness.

sa:
. न हि देहभृता शक्यं त्यक्तुं कर्माण्यशेषतः ।
यस्तु कर्मफलत्यागी स त्यागीत्यभिधीयते ॥
tl:
. na hi dehabhṛtā śakyaṃ
tyaktuṃ karmāṇyaśeṣataḥ yastu karmaphalatyāgī sa tyāgītyabhidhīyate
en: Possessing a body, man cannot, in fact, give up action entirely. He has to continue with essential actions. It is the idea of their fruits that he must renounce. If he does this, he is called a man of renunciation.

sa:
. अनिष्टमिष्टं मिश्रं च त्रिविधं कर्मणः फलम् ।
भवत्यत्यागिनां प्रेत्य न तु संन्यासिनां क्वचित् ॥
tl:
. aniṣṭamiṣṭaṃ miśraṃ ca trividhaṃ karmaṇaḥ
phalam bhavatyatyāgināṃ pretya na tu saṃnyāsināṃ kvacit
en: For those who have not renounced the idea of the fruits of action, the fruits are threefold: welcome, unwelcome, and mixed. Those, however, who have renounced attachment to the fruits of action are free from such influences.

sa:
. पञ्चैतानि महाबाहो कारणानि निबोध मे ।
सांख्ये कृतान्ते प्रोक्तानि सिद्धये सर्वकर्मणाम् ॥
tl:
. pañcaitāni mahābāho kāraṇāni nibodha
me sāṃkhye kṛtānte proktāni siddhaye sarvakarmaṇām
en: In the Saankhya scriptures, five factors have been mentioned as instrumental in the accomplishment of any action. Arjun, it is my opinion that these scriptures are correct.

sa:
. अधिष्ठानं तथा कर्ता करणं च पृथग्विधम् ।
विविधाश्च पृथक्चेष्टा दैवं चैवात्र पञ्चमम् ॥
tl:
. adhiṣṭhānaṃ tathā kartā karaṇaṃ ca
pṛthagvidham vividhāśca pṛthakceṣṭā daivaṃ caivātra pañcamam
en: The factors are: one, the source of action; two, the agent, or doer; three, the various instruments of the action; four, the separate modes, or movements of divergent nature; five, the destined idea contained in the womb of nature.

sa:
. शरीरवाङ्मनोभिर्यत्कर्म प्रारभते नरः ।
न्याय्यं वा विपरीतं वा पञ्चैते तस्य हेतवः ॥
tl:
. śarīravāṅmanobhiryatkarma prārabhate naraḥ nyāyyaṃ
vā viparītaṃ vā pañcaite tasya hetavaḥ
en: These five factors are the contributing causes of all actions, right or wrong, that man performs through mind, speech, and body.

sa:
. तत्रैवं सति कर्तारमात्मानं केवलं तु यः ।
पश्यत्यकृतबुद्धित्वान्न स पश्यति दुर्मतिः ॥
tl:
. tatraivaṃ sati kartāramātmānaṃ kevalaṃ
tu yaḥ paśyatyakṛtabuddhitvānna sa paśyati durmatiḥ
en: If, because of the impurity of his mind, someone regards the flawless Self as the doer, his understanding is wrong. The Self, who alone is everywhere as one Reality, cannot entertain the idea that He is a subject or a doer, some other entity is an object to be acted upon, and action is a third entity through which the doing is performed. On the other hand, a man with an impure mind, which is the sense of duality, is bound to understand doership as taking place between a subject and an object. Thus, when he uses the function of the sense of duality and superimposes it on the Oneness of the Self, calling the Self the doer, he does not understand the reality of doership and non-doership at all.

sa:
. यस्य नाहंकृतो भावो बुद्धिर्यस्य न लिप्यते ।
हत्वापि स इमाँल्लोकान्न हन्ति न निबध्यते ॥
tl:
. yasya nāhaṃkṛto bhāvo buddhiryasya na
lipyate hatvāpi sa imā̃llokānna hanti na nibadhyate
en: Arjun, I will tell you one fact about the performance of action. He who is free from identification with doership and whose reason does not become affected by experiencing objects and performing activities, he, even if many creatures are destroyed by him, still does not become the doer in their destruction, and he is not bound by any sin. But one must first attain this free state of mind in which one is constantly aware that the body is not the doer.

sa:
. ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं परिज्ञाता त्रिविधा कर्मचोदना ।
करणं कर्म कर्तेति त्रिविधः कर्मसंग्रहः ॥
tl:
. jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ parijñātā trividhā
karmacodanā karaṇaṃ karma karteti trividhaḥ karmasaṃgrahaḥ
en: Individual action depends upon that sense which, functioning as a dividing factor, makes one believe that there is a triad of knower, knowledge, and object of knowledge, as also, doer, activity, and the bodily Instruments of action. When these triads are finished, there will be no motivation for action.

sa:
. ज्ञानं कर्म च कर्ता च त्रिधैव गुणभेदतः ।
प्रोच्यते गुणसंख्याने यथावच्छृणु तान्यपि ॥
tl:
. jñānaṃ karma ca kartā ca
tridhaiva guṇabhedataḥ procyate guṇasaṃkhyāne yathāvacchṛṇu tānyapi
en: Arjun, now hear from Me the threefold divisions of gyaan, karm, and kartaa, or knowledge, action, and the doer, which are dealt with in this branch of knowledge. These divisions are based upon the varying predominance of one of the three gunas of Prakriti, nature.

sa:
. सर्वभूतेषु येनैकं भावमव्ययमीक्षते ।
अविभक्तं विभक्तेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि सात्त्विकम् ॥
tl:
. sarvabhūteṣu yenaikaṃ bhāvamavyayamīkṣate
avibhaktaṃ vibhakteṣu tajjñānaṃ viddhi sāttvikam
en: Knowledge is sattwik by which man perceives God as One, the imperishable, undivided, and equally present Divine Existence in all individual beings.

sa:
. पृथक्त्वेन तु यज्ज्ञानं नानाभावान्पृथग्विधान् ।
वेत्ति सर्वेषु भूतेषु तज्ज्ञानं विद्धि राजसम् ॥
tl:
. pṛthaktvena tu yajjñānaṃ nānābhāvānpṛthagvidhān
vetti sarveṣu bhūteṣu tajjñānaṃ viddhi rājasam
en: Knowledge is raajsik by which man perceives the many, varied states of existence of all beings as separate, one from another.

sa:
. यत्तु कृत्स्नवदेकस्मिन्कार्ये सक्तमहैतुकम् ।
अतत्त्वार्थवदल्पं च तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl: . yattu kṛtsnavadekasminkārye saktamahaitukam atattvārthavadalpaṃ ca tattāmasamudāhṛtam
en: Knowledge is taamsik by which a man clings to only one body, knowing it as the Whole; and knowledge is taamsik which is irrational, has no real object, and is of little value.

sa:
. नियतं सङ्गरहितमरागद्वेषतः कृतम् ।
अफलप्रेप्सुना कर्म यत्तत्सात्त्विकमुच्यते ॥
tl: . niyataṃ saṅgarahitamarāgadveṣataḥ kṛtam aphalaprepsunā karma yattatsāttvikamucyate
en: Arjun, when the action performed by the seeker of liberation is ordained by the scriptures and is performed without any sense of doership, without raag, partiality, and without dwaysh, prejudice, it is called sattwik.

sa:
. यत्तु कामेप्सुना कर्म साहंकारेण वा पुनः ।
क्रियते बहुलायासं तद्राजसमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl:
. yattu kāmepsunā karma sāhaṃkāreṇa
vā punaḥ kriyate bahulāyāsaṃ tadrājasamudāhṛtam
en: Action involving strain and performed by a man full of egoism for the purpose of seeking enjoyment is raajsik.

sa:
. अनुबन्धं क्षयं हिंसामनवेक्ष्य च पौरुषम् ।
मोहादारभ्यते कर्म यत्तत्तामसमुच्यते ॥
tl:
. anubandhaṃ kṣayaṃ hiṃsāmanavekṣya
ca pauruṣam mohādārabhyate karma yattattāmasamucyate
en: Action is taamsik which is performed through sheer ignorance, and without consideration of bondage, loss to oneself, injury to others, or detriment to one’s own capability.

sa:
. मुक्तसङ्गोऽनहंवादी धृत्युत्साहसमन्वितः ।
सिद्ध्यसिद्ध्योर्निर्विकारः कर्ता सात्त्विक उच्यते ॥
tl: . muktasaṅgo’nahaṃvādī dhṛtyutsāhasamanvitaḥ siddhyasiddhyornirvikāraḥ kartā sāttvika ucyate
en: Arjun, that doer who is free from the sense of attachment and egoism, free from the influence of success and failure, an endowed with firmness and zeal is called sattwik.

sa:
. रागी कर्मफलप्रेप्सुर्लुब्धो हिंसात्मकोऽशुचिः ।
हर्षशोकान्वितः कर्ता राजसः परिकीर्तितः ॥
tl: . rāgī karmaphalaprepsurlubdho hiṃsātmako’śuciḥ harṣaśokānvitaḥ kartā rājasaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
en: The doer who has a sense of attachment, who seeks the fruits of action, who is greedy and oppressive by nature, who is impure of conduct and easily affected by joy and sorrow is called raajsik.

sa:
. अयुक्तः प्राकृतः स्तब्धः शठो नैष्कृतिकोऽलसः ।
विषादी दीर्घसूत्री च कर्ता तामस उच्यते ॥
tl:
. ayuktaḥ prākṛtaḥ stabdhaḥ śaṭho naiṣkṛtiko’lasaḥ
viṣādī dīrghasūtrī ca kartā tāmasa ucyate
en: That doer is taamsik who is not self-controlled or cultured, who is, rather, arrogant and deceitful, who possesses the cleverness to rob others of their livelihood, and who is dull, down-hearted, and a procrastinator.

sa:
. बुद्धेर्भेदं धृतेश्चैव गुणतस्त्रिविधं शृणु ।
प्रोच्यमानमशेषेण पृथक्त्वेन धनंजय ॥
tl: . buddherbhedaṃ dhṛteścaiva guṇatastrividhaṃ śṛṇu procyamānamaśeṣeṇa pṛthaktvena dhanaṃjaya
en: Arjun, now hear from Me a full description first of buddhi, the power of reason, and then of dhriti, the sense of firmness, each divided threefold according to the predominance of each guna.

sa:
. प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च कार्याकार्ये भयाभये ।
बन्धं मोक्षं च या वेत्ति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥
tl:
. pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca kāryākārye bhayābhaye bandhaṃ
mokṣaṃ ca yā vetti buddhiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
en: Arjun, that buddhi, or intellect, is sattwik and full of reason which is able to determine correctly the paths of renunciation and right action, what should or should not be done, and is able to discern the natures of fear and fearlessness, as well as of bondage and liberation.

sa:
. यया धर्ममधर्मं च कार्यं चाकार्यमेव च ।
अयथावत्प्रजानाति बुद्धिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥
tl:
. yayā dharmamadharmaṃ ca kāryaṃ cākāryameva
ca ayathāvatprajānāti buddhiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
en: That intellect is raajsik which does not assist man in perceiving truly what dharm, righteousness, and adharm, unrighteousness, are and which confuses him in deciding what should or should not be done.

sa:
. अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता ।
सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥
tl:
. adharmaṃ dharmamiti yā manyate
tamasāvṛtā sarvārthānviparītāṃśca buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
en: And, Arjun, that intellect is taamsik which makes man imagine unrighteousness to be righteousness and wraps him in ignorance, thus making him perceive everything to be the reverse of what it actually is.

sa:
. धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः ।
योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी ॥
tl:
. dhṛtyā yayā dhārayate manaḥprāṇendriyakriyāḥ
yogenāvyabhicāriṇyā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
en: Arjun, that unwavering dhriti is called sattwik by which a man is able to control the functions of the mind, praanik energies, and senses through adopting the course of meditation, which is Yog.

sa:
. यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन ।
प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी ॥
tl:
. yayā tu dharmakāmārthāndhṛtyā dhārayate’rjuna
prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣī dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
en: Arjun, that dhriti is called raajsik by which a man seeks reward for his actions with extreme attachment to virtues, earthly possessions, and worldly enjoyments.

sa:
. यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च ।
न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी ॥
tl:
. yayā svapnaṃ bhayaṃ śokaṃ viṣādaṃ madameva
ca na vimuñcati durmedhā dhṛtiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
en: And, Arjun, that dhriti is called taamsik by which a man becomes evil-minded and clings to sleep, fear, anxiety, sorrow, and pride.

sa:
. सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ ।
अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति ॥
tl:
. sukhaṃ tvidānīṃ trividhaṃ śṛṇu me
bharatarṣabha abhyāsādramate yatra duḥkhāntaṃ ca nigacchati
en: Arjun, now listen to Me carefully regarding joy, which is of three kinds, again according to the predominance of one of the gunas of Prakriti. Joy is sattwik in which a man finds satisfaction through the practice of meditation, worship, and service to God, and by which he eliminates sorrow and attains placidity of mind. No doubt such practice appears like poison in the beginning, but certainly in the end it tastes like nectar.

sa:
यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम् ।
तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम् ॥
tl: yattadagre viṣamiva pariṇāme’mṛtopamam tatsukhaṃ sāttvikaṃ proktamātmabuddhiprasādajam
en: Arjun, now listen to Me carefully regarding joy, which is of three kinds, again according to the predominance of one of the gunas of Prakriti. Joy is sattwik in which a man finds satisfaction through the practice of meditation, worship, and service to God, and by which he eliminates sorrow and attains placidity of mind. No doubt such practice appears like poison in the beginning, but certainly in the end it tastes like nectar.

sa:
. विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम् ।
परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम् ॥
tl: . viṣayendriyasaṃyogādyattadagre’mṛtopamam pariṇāme viṣamiva tatsukhaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam
en: Arjun, that joy which is felt after the senses have contacted their objects is called raajsik joy. No doubt it appears like nectar at first, but eventually it turns out to be poison.

sa:
. यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः ।
निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ॥
tl: . yadagre cānubandhe ca sukhaṃ mohanamātmanaḥ nidrālasyapramādotthaṃ tattāmasamudāhṛtam
en: Arjun, that joy is taamsik which, during the period of enjoyment stupefies the jeevaatmaa, the individual self, and keeps that self unenlightened at the completion of enjoyment. It is derived from sleep, indolence, and error.

sa:
. न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः ।
सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात् त्रिभिर्गुणैः ॥
tl:
. na tadasti pṛthivyāṃ vā divi deveṣu
vā punaḥ sattvaṃ prakṛtijairmuktaṃ yadebhiḥ syāt tribhirguṇaiḥ
en: Arjun, I want to inform you of the fact that there is no being on earth or in the middle region or in the region of the gods that is free from the influence of these three gunas of Prakriti. Therefore, one must make a special effort to get beyond their domination.

sa:
. ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परंतप ।
कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः ॥
tl: . brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviśāṃ śūdrāṇāṃ ca paraṃtapa karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāvaprabhavairguṇaiḥ
en: Arjun, duties and actions have been divided into four categories according to the inborn natures of men’s minds. The four types of mind are as follows: that which is interested in learning, that which is endowed with the sense of protecting, that which is meant for producing goods, and that which is endowed with the sense of rendering service in all possible ways.

sa:
. शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च ।
ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम् ॥
tl:
. śamo damastapaḥ śaucaṃ kṣāntirārjavameva
ca jñānaṃ vijñānamāstikyaṃ brahmakarma svabhāvajam
en: The duties and actions to be performed by the men of the first category are control of the mind and senses, unmindfulness of hardship in the discharge of sacred obligations, maintenance of external and internal purity, forgiveness of the mistakes of others, clarity of mind, senses, and behaviour, faith in the Vedas and other holy scriptures, unbroken belief in the eternal existence of God and life, learning and teaching the Vedas and other scriptures, and constant practice of Self Realization, the attainment of God Consciousness. Arjun, all these are the duties meant for the mind which falls in the braahman category.

sa:
. शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम् ।
दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम् ॥
tl:
. śauryaṃ tejo dhṛtirdākṣyaṃ yuddhe
cāpyapalāyanam dānamīśvarabhāvaśca kṣātraṃ karma svabhāvajam
en: The natural duty of the chhatriya mind, endowed with the sense of protecting, is to exhibit valour, fearlessness, firmness, wisdom, steadiness in battle, and to offer gifts, exhibit lordliness, and extend protection to all around.

sa:
. कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम् ।
परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम् ॥
tl: . kṛṣigaurakṣyavāṇijyaṃ vaiśyakarma svabhāvajam paricaryātmakaṃ karma śūdrasyāpi svabhāvajam
en:
Arjun, the natural duty of the vaishya, that mind endowed with the sense of producing goods and trading materials, is to farm, exchange merchandise honestly, and protect cows. The natural duty of the shoodr, that mind endowed with the sense of service, is to serve and help all around him.
Since I am the Light, or Chaytnaa, of these mental categories, every man has all four qualities in him; but a man will only be referred to by the title of one of these categories when he has matured the specific quality of that category through practice.

sa:
. स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः ।
स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु ॥
tl:
. sve sve karmaṇyabhirataḥ saṃsiddhiṃ labhate
naraḥ svakarmanirataḥ siddhiṃ yathā vindati tacchṛṇu
en: Arjun, now listen as I describe the nature of performing one’s own rightful action, which will result in the highest success in the form of Self Realization.

sa:
. यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ।
स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः ॥
tl:
. yataḥ pravṛttirbhūtānāṃ yena sarvamidaṃ
tatam svakarmaṇā tamabhyarcya siddhiṃ vindati mānavaḥ
en: Man’s original duty is to reach the highest perfection, the highest Truth. If he stays in tune with this original, natural duty, he will attain the highest success, the attainment of that from which this flux of universal creation has issued forth and by which all this universe is pervaded.

sa:
. श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात् ।
स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम् ॥
tl: . śreyānsvadharmo viguṇaḥ paradharmātsvanuṣṭhitāt svabhāvaniyataṃ karma kurvannāpnoti kilbiṣam
