en: If one follows the rhythm of the evolutionary force, he is performing his duty. While performing those actions which lead him to his highest Truth, he may not find them very rewarding in terms of the material gain which those who have forgotten their duty may attain. He should not feel sorry about this because performing his own destined duty will take him to his goal. He will never be imperfect, or sinful.

sa:
. सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत् ।
सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः ॥
tl:
. sahajaṃ karma kaunteya sadoṣamapi
na tyajet sarvārambhā hi doṣeṇa dhūmenāgnirivāvṛtāḥ
en: Arjun, one should not, therefore, give up his inborn, natural duty, even though being on this path to the goal may appear very hard. Sometimes, every action appears full of mistakes, as fire appears full of smoke; but one should not make this state of mind a criterion for deciding whether or not to perform his duty. Not only smoke exists in a smoldering fire; flame also exists, but in potential form. Therefore, one should always hope to clear away the smoke of ignorance and allow the flame of Knowledge to shine.

sa:
. असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः ।
नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति ॥
tl: . asaktabuddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigataspṛhaḥ naiṣkarmyasiddhiṃ paramāṃ saṃnyāsenādhigacchati
en: Arjun, he who has gained the power of perfect reasoning, who is no longer attached to the sense of duality, whose weakness for the enjoyment of tastes contained in sense objects has been removed, who has realized his power to control his mind, and who has reach the Knowledge of his own Truth; he attains absolute perfection, the consummation of actionlessness.

sa:
. सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे ।
समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा ॥
tl:
. siddhiṃ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha
me samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣṭhā jñānasya yā parā
en: Arjun, hear now a short description of the process through which a man who has attained the state of actionlessness reaches the perfect Knowledge of Brahm, God, who is pure action or dynamism.

sa:
. बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च ।
शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च ॥
tl:
. buddhyā viśuddhayā yukto dhṛtyātmānaṃ
niyamya ca śabdādīnviṣayāṃstyaktvā rāgadveṣau vyudasya ca
en: A man who has attained the intellect of pure reasoning, who is regulated in a sattwik diet, who lives in a lonely and undefiled place, who has gained the power to remain uninvolved when the disturbances of the sense objects arise, who has attained the power to control his mind, speech, and body through sattwik firmness, who has gained the power of dispassion and is uninfluenced by any attraction or aversion, who has given up the ego sense, violence, arrogance, lust, anger, and the desire for luxuries, who has gone beyond the sense of “mine” and “thine” and become peaceful at heart, and who has acquired the power to devote his energy to the Yog of Meditation; such a man becomes qualified to attain the state of Realization that is Oneness with God, Brahm, whose true nature is Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, and Pure Bliss.

sa:
विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः ।
ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः ॥
tl: viviktasevī laghvāśī yatavākkāyamānasaḥ dhyānayogaparo nityaṃ vairāgyaṃ samupāśritaḥ
en: A man who has attained the intellect of pure reasoning, who is regulated in a sattwik diet, who lives in a lonely and undefiled place, who has gained the power to remain uninvolved when the disturbances of the sense objects arise, who has attained the power to control his mind, speech, and body through sattwik firmness, who has gained the power of dispassion and is uninfluenced by any attraction or aversion, who has given up the ego sense, violence, arrogance, lust, anger, and the desire for luxuries, who has gone beyond the sense of “mine” and “thine” and become peaceful at heart, and who has acquired the power to devote his energy to the Yog of Meditation; such a man becomes qualified to attain the state of Realization that is Oneness with God, Brahm, whose true nature is Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, and Pure Bliss.

sa:
अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम् ।
विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
tl:
ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ
parigraham vimucya nirmamaḥ śānto brahmabhūyāya kalpate
en: A man who has attained the intellect of pure reasoning, who is regulated in a sattwik diet, who lives in a lonely and undefiled place, who has gained the power to remain uninvolved when the disturbances of the sense objects arise, who has attained the power to control his mind, speech, and body through sattwik firmness, who has gained the power of dispassion and is uninfluenced by any attraction or aversion, who has given up the ego sense, violence, arrogance, lust, anger, and the desire for luxuries, who has gone beyond the sense of “mine” and “thine” and become peaceful at heart, and who has acquired the power to devote his energy to the Yog of Meditation; such a man becomes qualified to attain the state of Realization that is Oneness with God, Brahm, whose true nature is Pure Existence, Pure Consciousness, and Pure Bliss.

sa:
. ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति ।
समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम् ॥
tl:
. brahmabhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śocati na
kāṅkṣati samaḥ sarveṣu bhūteṣu madbhaktiṃ labhate parām
en: He who is established in Oneness with Brahm is cheerful at heart. He does not grieve or crave for anything anymore, and sees God in all beings. Such a man of supreme devotion to Me attains the state of perfection.

sa:
. भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः ।
ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम् ॥
tl:
. bhaktyā māmabhijānāti yāvānyaścāsmi tattvataḥ
tato māṃ tattvato jñātvā viśate tadanantaram
en: Through his supreme devotion he realizes My Truth. He comes to know how infinite in Existence, Consciousness, and Bliss I am, and soon, he realizes Oneness with My Being.

sa:
. सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः ।
मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम् ॥
tl: . sarvakarmāṇyapi sadā kurvāṇo madvyapāśrayaḥ matprasādādavāpnoti śāśvataṃ padamavyayam
en: He who has become completely surrendered to Me, offering Me all his duties, by My grace attains the state of unity which is eternal and imperishable. Then, throughout the rest of his life, even while performing action, he is never bound by ignorance.

sa:
. चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः ।
बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव ॥
tl:
. cetasā sarvakarmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya
matparaḥ buddhiyogamupāśritya maccittaḥ satataṃ bhava
en: Therefore, Arjun, offer all your identification and duties to Me, follow the course of Yog, or Knowledge, which keeps you even-minded and balanced, and remain surrendered and devoted to Me.

sa:
. मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि ।
अथ चेत्त्वमहंकारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि ॥
tl: . maccittaḥ sarvadurgāṇi matprasādāttariṣyasi atha cettvamahaṃkārānna śroṣyasi vinaṅkṣyasi
en: Arjun, if, under the influence of your ego consciousness, you do not listen to Me, you will be lost; however, if you follow My advice and give your mind to Me, then by My grace, you will overcome all the difficulties in your way.

sa:
. यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे ।
मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति ॥
tl:
. yadahaṃkāramāśritya na yotsya iti
manyase mithyaiṣa vyavasāyaste prakṛtistvāṃ niyokṣyati
en: Know that if you remain under the influence of your ego consciousness and think “I will not fight,” this kind of resolution born of identification with your body and mind will not bring success. My nature, or power, over and above your mental resolve will compel you to perform your action.

sa:
. स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा ।
कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात् करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत् ॥
tl:
. svabhāvajena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena
karmaṇā kartuṃ necchasi yanmohāt kariṣyasyavaśo’pi tat
en: Since you are bound by the destined duty born of your nature, you will be compelled to perform your duty even if, due to the sheer ignorance of attachment to your body, you are not willing to initiate it.

sa:
. ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति ।
भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया ॥
tl: . īśvaraḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ hṛddeśe’rjuna tiṣṭhati bhrāmayansarvabhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā
en: Arjun, you must know that each being resides in the vehicle called his body and that God abides eternally in the hearts of all beings inspiring them to revolve in the wheel of bodies according to the qualities, actions, and natures already destined by their seed karm. God does all this by His power of Consciousness, which to man is a mystery; for a magic doll created by a magician can never know the tricks of his master.

sa:
. तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत ।
तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम् ॥
tl:
. tameva śaraṇaṃ gaccha sarvabhāvena
bhārata tatprasādātparāṃ śāntiṃ sthānaṃ prāpsyasi śāśvatam
en: Arjun, with all your being, surrender completely to the Lord alone. By His grace you will attain the state of perfection in the form of supreme peace and immortality.

sa:
. इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया ।
विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु ॥
tl:
. iti te jñānamākhyātaṃ guhyādguhyataraṃ
mayā vimṛśyaitadaśeṣeṇa yathecchasi tathā kuru
en: Arjun, this Wisdom, which is more secret than secrecy itself, has been imparted to you. Now ponder over it fully and do as you wish.

sa:
. सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः ।
इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम् ॥
tl:
. sarvaguhyatamaṃ bhūyaḥ śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ
iṣṭo’si me dṛḍhamiti tato vakṣyāmi te hitam
en: Arjun, listen once again to My advice, My most secret word. It is esoteric in nature, but because you are extremely dear to Me, I offer it to you once again.

sa:
. मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु ।
मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे ॥
tl:
. manmanā bhava madbhakto madyājī māṃ
namaskuru māmevaiṣyasi satyaṃ te pratijāne priyo’si me
en: The secret is this: You must give your mind to Me, devote yourself to Me, worship Me, bow to Me, and unite with Me. By doing so, you will become one with Me and in your mind there will never appear any sense of separation or otherness. Because you are exceptionally dear to Me, I promise you this.

sa:
. सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज ।
अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः ॥
tl:
. sarvadharmānparityajya māmekaṃ śaraṇaṃ vraja
ahaṃ tvā sarvapāpebhyo mokṣayiṣyāmi mā śucaḥ
en: Offer all your duties to Me, know that I am the all-powerful and all-supporting Lord, and surrender your individual, identified self to Me completely. I shall free you from all your imperfections or sins. You need not worry.

sa:
. इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन ।
न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति ॥
tl:
. idaṃ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadācana
na cāśuśrūṣave vācyaṃ na ca māṃ yo’bhyasūyati
en: This Knowledge should never be imparted to anyone lacking intelligence, nor to one powerless to follow it, nor to him who lacks devotion, nor to him who pays no attention while listening to it, and certainly not to him who finds fault with God.

sa:
. य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति ।
भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः ॥
tl:
. ya imaṃ paramaṃ guhyaṃ
madbhakteṣvabhidhāsyati bhaktiṃ mayi parāṃ kṛtvā māmevaiṣyatyasaṃśayaḥ
en: He who is supremely devoted to Me and who takes it upon himself to teach this most secret Knowledge to those who deserve it is beloved of Me. He will receive all that he desires. There is no doubt about his attaining unity with Me, the Supreme Being.

sa:
. न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मेप्रियकृत्तमः ।
भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि ॥
tl:
. na ca tasmānmanuṣyeṣu kaścinmepriyakṛttamaḥ bhavitā
na ca me tasmādanyaḥ priyataro bhuvi
en: On the entire globe there is no one dearer to Me than he who performs this service for Me.

sa:
. अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः ।
ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः ॥
tl:
. adhyeṣyate ca ya imaṃ dharmyaṃ
saṃvādamāvayoḥ jñānayajñena tenāhamiṣṭaḥ syāmiti me matiḥ
en: Whoever studies this sacred dialogue of ours will acquire a sense of worshiping Me, and so will attain the Knowledge of Me.

sa:
. श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः ।
सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम् ॥
tl: . śraddhāvānanasūyaśca śṛṇuyādapi yo naraḥ so’pi muktaḥ śubhā̃llokānprāpnuyātpuṇyakarmaṇām
en: The man who listens to this Knowledge with reverence and faith, free from fault-finding, will be liberated from ignorance and will find no difficulties in his life. He will enjoy merits equal to those who have reached the happy worlds of the virtuous.

sa:
. कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा ।
कच्चिदज्ञानसंमोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनंजय ॥
tl: . kaccidetacchrutaṃ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa cetasā kaccidajñānasaṃmohaḥ pranaṣṭaste dhanaṃjaya
en:
To confirm that Arjun had understood, Shri Krishn asked:
Shri Krishn asked:
Have you heard Me with your mind one-pointed, Arjun? And has your doubt and delusion born of ignorance melted away, O victor of all prosperity?

sa:
अर्जुन उवाच नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत ।
स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव ॥
tl:
arjuna uvāca naṣṭo mohaḥ smṛtirlabdhā
tvatprasādānmayācyuta sthito’smi gatasandehaḥ kariṣye vacanaṃ tava
en:
Arjun replied:
Lord, I express my gratitude to You. By Your grace, my doubt, delusion, and attachment to ignorance have been completely dispelled and Wisdom has dawned in me. I stand established in perfect Knowledge, totally free from all doubts, and I promise I will do Your bidding, which will be my utmost pleasure.

sa:
. संजय उवाच इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः ।
संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम् ॥
tl:
. saṃjaya uvāca ityahaṃ vāsudevasya
pārthasya ca mahātmanaḥ saṃvādamimamaśrauṣamadbhutaṃ romaharṣaṇam
en:
Sanjay said to Dhritraashtr:
This was the mysterious and thrilling conversation between Lord Krishn and the highly evolved soul, Arjun, the son of Mother Kunti.

sa:
. व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम् ।
योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम् ॥
tl: . vyāsaprasādācchrutavānetadguhyamahaṃ param yogaṃ yogeśvarātkṛṣṇātsākṣātkathayataḥ svayam
en: It was Shri Vyaas who blessed me with divine vision, so I thank him again and again, for by his grace I have been able to hear this supremely secret Knowledge from the Lord of Yog, Shri Krishn Himself, as He imparted it before my very eyes to Arjun.

sa:
. राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम् ।
केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः ॥
tl:
. rājansaṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya saṃvādamimamadbhutam
keśavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṃ hṛṣyāmi ca muhurmuhuḥ
en: Over and over, I recall this sacred and mystic conversation between Lord Krishn and Arjun, and, O King, I rejoice again and again.

sa:
. तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः ।
विस्मयो मे महान् राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः ॥
tl:
. tacca saṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya rūpamatyadbhutaṃ hareḥ
vismayo me mahān rājanhṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ
en: O King, I keep remembering the glorious form of Lord Krishn, and that form is a great wonder to me. Again and again I rejoice.

sa:
. यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः ।
तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम ॥
tl:
. yatra yogeśvaraḥ kṛṣṇo yatra
pārtho dhanurdharaḥ tatra śrīrvijayo bhūtirdhruvā nītirmatirmama
en:
Whereever in any heart there are Lord Sri Krishn, the Lord of Yog and Perfection, and Arjun, the wielder of the mighty bow Gaandeev, Gyaan-deep, there will dwell goodness, glory, perfect righteousness, and victory. Such is my conviction.
The chapter known as Moksh Sannyaas Yog ends.
